I have been here a few times and have had better experiences. My fries were way too salty and my steak was rather tough and missed the mark. The noise level was nice and quiet.
We had a Martini in the bar first, loved it. Should have eaten in the bar. Service was ok in the restaurant but great in the bar. I like the ambiance in the bar. Restaurant is BRIGHT.
Very nice atmosphere, a little crowded though. A lot of tables stuffed into small places. The bar was nice but the food was not good. The price, high.
Food was below average. Felt extremely comfortable in the dining area even for the Friday night.

I was expecting some dishes from the Northern Italian Cuisine. The menu was not distinguishable from any other chain. The food was good but no differentiation. It was noisy, but I believe by design. Waiter was extremely attentive.
This is really a tourist attraction with terrible ambiance, more than a restaurant. The view is obviously why you would go, not the food. Service was great, drinks too.
Food was generally good, although all the dishes were somewhat salty.
Service was horrible. Food made up for the bad service. Large portions, very flavorful.
Service was very poor, but the food was great..clearly they are just appealing to tourists and could care less if you come back.
Max's Alley is always a good experience. Food is bad & we've always had excellent service.

Food was a disappointment, duck confit parpadelle was so greasy it was closer to diner food. Shame, not to the standards of most South End restaurants. The ambiance was nice and the tables weren't too close together
One of several trips to Harry's. It's always loud. The food has been better, a very tough and tasteless steak sandwich was lunch this time. At least there is a respectable wine list.

We seemed to be there on a wrong day as some menu choices were not available and the food (main courses) was lukewarm at best when it arrived .. not impressed by lack of menus for desserts etc.. The place was beautiful, though.
Lovely restaurant, good service, mediocre food, loud dining room
Underwhelming. The food is average. The service is good. There are many cheaper, better options in NYC.

Good brunch deal, but food is a bit bland. Friendly service. Patio area is OK but a little rough around the edges, ie there was an old sconce behind my head that I hit a few times.  Ambiance could use some help.
Our first time at Frankie's and we were all not very pleased. The chef is excellent! Our service was very, very, good, but ambiance was ok.
For many years it was one of my favorites; however, the prices have doubled and I will not be returning soon even if the food remains good as always.
Went for a birthday brunch, everyone left hungry and unsatisfied but the noise level was perfect.
Food was painfully mediocre despite a delicious looking menu. Our server made up for it as she met our needs quickly.
The food was OK and the service passable with a nice noise level for dining. We will return.
I had heard wonderful things about Il Capriccio and was looking forward to the evening and was very pleased with the ambience but the food was just OK.
Food was good, disappointed by the service and ambiance
Our food was OK and the service was good. The prices are high and the portions are small. Probably won't go again.
The view is spectatular. The food was inconsistent. The service was terrible. The noise level was good, however.
Entrees and menu for dinner was excellent. Need to improve on deserts. Just average. Music was too loud, not good for romantic date.
We were seated downstairs. The service was slow. We all enjoyed the food.
i have been to centro before and enjoyed it. typically solid except the service was lacking. ordered cheese and meat tray which was very disappointing. will try restaurant again, nonetheless.
Kitchen was very overloaded due to a large party in the back room. One dish was so sweet to be inedible, restaurant comped that dish, so they did the right thing.
Saving grace: most conveient restaurant for Roundabout @ American Airlines Theater. Great decor and vibe.

unfortunately, there was a crush of people waiting for the second seating -- definitely impacted those poor diners who were seated near the front door. There needs to be a more defined waiting area.  Food was well worth the wait.
Basically they were understaffed. My Pregnant wife had to ask for water 3 times. Food was great though.
martinis served in champagne flutes
Scones at brunch were incredible, but we couldn't hear ourselves think.
Great food, too bad that it feels like an outdated, overpriced formal dining experience with too much noise.
the food was good service was great . also very noisey- food was good but two orders were not cooked as ordered.
The food was just fair. It is way over priced. We were in a little corner and could have a decent conversation, without it being to loud.
food was great; service and ambiance was less than.
Below-street-level restaurant.
Although we were kept waiting a little too long to be seated despite our reservation, that little annoyance was erased by excellent service.
We were seated in a separate room away from the main seating area. It seemed to be aroom for biger parties. The main room had many available seats, so I don't know what the problem was.

Very expensive. Food just regular . Good wine list but too much expensive.
Dress code business casual ? There were men with t-shirt and tennis shoe .
I'll definitely come back.
I really enjoyed the food. The service was quite poor -- we waited 20 minutes to order our food after the drinks came, and it was super loud and quite bright.
Megan was our server and she was awful. I had requested seating outside for 2 and the table was great. Food was amazing and fun.
Overall pastas were very good. Appitizers needed some work. Calamari was very tough. Portions were right sizes. Noise level was high.
Fantastic salads, mains and cocktails. Dessert was good but not extraordinary. But the service was just not very good.
Everyone was very attentive. We ate the 12 course meal, which took too long. I think we were all ready to leave by the 8th or 9th course.
I was expecting top quality Pasta dishes, but to my dismay, it was no better than Olive Garden. At least the decor and ambiance were great, and service was very attentive.
very decent food but not exciting; good atmosphere (though was uncrowded due to weather); very good, pleasant service. Nothing wrong, reasonably priced, but nothing particularly distinctive, either.
Kind service.Burnt Food. Friendly Staff
Nothing to write home about. Unless you suffer from low blood pressure, beware of the salt. The noise was amazing and the restaurant was quiet
not as good as we'd expected....very few choices for vegetarians....our service was good, though
Excellent appetizers, salads and desserts. Entrees marginal. It was too loud in the dining room though.
The service was great. Try one of Mr. Batali's other restaurants, like Otto, which was both better and cheaper.
Very expensive; decent, clean, but hardly exciting or for foodies
Just average.

This restaurant really needs to work on its ambiance. Some great service going on though. Food okay but not what I remember from
Michel Richard.
Over all a pleasant experience, though the service was not up to par, waited to long for bread and ordering.
Had the best $16 burger in town-- but service very poor!
Nothing spectacular. The chocolate pudding is incredibly rich and yummy.
Our server Nikki was the worst!  We have found that each time we have visited Cafe Roma that our experience has been better than the last. Bravo!
Overll an ok dining experience. Menu was a bit overly complicated but the food was really great.
I was not pleased. This venue does not accept AMERICAN EXPRESS GIFT CHEQUES!!! That is rediculous. This medium is the same as CASH. At least the food was good
They had the best lemonade and great dessert, but the food was average. They boast of the 2 guys from Italy with a special menu.....blah blah too much noise in there!
Great food, great service, bad atmosphere...a puzzling combination!
We did the fixed menu which was a 5 course deal that took 3 hours. The food was all horrible and the service was outstanding!

Not bad
The quality of the food was above average

Small plates were quite tasty. But entrees were pallid and overdone with butter and cheese. The noise was so loud that we could carry a conversation across the table without yelling across the table. But it was clean and fancy.
Food was good..3 out of 5 stars. The chocolate dessert for Valentines Day was horrible however...it tasted like frosting and not thought out at all by the chef. Hard to hold a conversation.
We had restaurant week menu. Overall it's OK but not very impressed and feel kind of cheap bases on the service or food we had.
just okay food for the price. The wait staff was very nice and attentive.
Be alert with valet service - its slow and they misplace keys/car, but the food was delicious.
The adult food was good and the service was pretty bad. The kids food was not that good.
Was expecting a fine dining experience; instead, tables under a metal roof. Would be great lunch spot, especially coming off the lake. Prices very high for a place like this.
Food was excellent, but the service was not very attentive. Noise level was extremely high due to close proximity of tables and poor acoustics.
On a beautiful night the patio is fabulous. The food was average but service and ambiance were loud and noisy.
Not a romantic spot. The noise was a bit much. Food was good.
We were thrilled to learn that Cafe Du Parc was open for dinner on the night of the 2010 blizzard when everyone else was closed. The food was just alright.
I like the place. Good Ambiance. Food was very ordinary, especially the fish. And for what it was, I think it was over priced.
A wonderful find in Cambridge. Food was not very enjoyable.. Wine selection very dull. Did not enjoy the Restaurant Week dinner menu. Small, cozy and has a true neighborhood feel.
Food is pretty mediocre, but priced as if it's outstanding.
ok neighborhood restaurant but noisy with nothing special

huge portions are family style, but nothing particularly outstanding in tase/quality. Just ok. Extremely NOISY. Won't rush back. Waiters were extremely nice and quick, definitely made things a little better.
Nice views, but food doesn't match up. Barely neighborhood Italian quality, but with more pretension. Maybe for your tourist friends. They won't mind the quietness here.
FOOD IS GOOD NOT GRETA SERVICE IS VERY GOOD HOSTESS , WELL NEEDS A LITTLE HELP IN CUSTOMER SERVICE. THE MUSIC WAS REALLY GOOD.

Our entrees were all delcious, no complaints there, but the waiter obviously did not have kids because towards the end of the meal he completely disappeared not understanding that even well behaved kids have a limit before they just can't sit anymore.
Went for Mothers Day Brunch. Food was great, waitstaff did not know the menu though. Great views.
While the ambience was unpleasant and the service, for the most part, attentive, the food was, on the whole, fairly delicious.
The service is always consistant but the food can be hit or miss.
The food was good. The booth seating was extremely uncomfortable, not enough room between table and seat.
Lovely atmosphere, but the food is terrible. Too bad. Service was good though.
It was so noisy that it wasn't possible to talk to my wife without raising my voice and she has great hearing! Food was great!
Nice restaurant with good food. Plan on staying a while since service is quite fast. Food was luke warm at best.
Always dependably good service, but the food is mediocre.
Our second time eating at Stella Sola and still our new favorite restaurant! The food could be better though.
TWO ITEMS: 1. The tables are far to close together. It is difficult to walk between them. Food was creative and delicious.
We have been here before and is a great old SF place , many locals and for tourist it would be a great experience. The ambiance was not that great though
Hadn't eaten here in 2 - 3 yrs and servers seemed frazzled; the food was ok...my risotto was burnt on the edges...but it was well lite and romantic.

Good brunch deal, but food is a bit bland. Patio area is nice but a little rough around the edges, ie there was an old sconce behind my head that I hit a few times.

Our watiress was great. I'm just sorry I forgot her name, but we did tip her well. Bad food though.
Food was excellent, but the waiter was very loud and not very helpful.
Lovely setting - and very, very fast service. We were also disappointed that the specials were all unavailable by the time we ordered.
What a bad experience..we had to wait 1 hour and 45 minutes for our food which to my surprise was very tasty....
poor menu and no desserts at lunch, but our waitress was fantastic.
Depressing ambience. However, food, service, and a great reasonably priced wine list make up for it!

too noisy...I went there for a business lunch and it was just too noisy. Luckily the food was splendid.
what a terrible  spot for a romantic dinner; amazing service; and wonderful food.

A decent meal in the French Quarter. The signature dish-- the Red Fish-- is quite overpriced at nearly $33.
Very poor ambiance but very good service. The food was okay, but not worth the prices charged, IMHO. City Table *did* introduce me to a fine Pinot Noir, however -- the 2008 Hob Nob. Loved it!

Could be so much better if the food and ambience was upgraded a notch or two. The service doesn't need to be upgraded since it is already great. Would like to see the owners invest a little money into the place.

Food was fantastic. Skate was drowning in a salty lemon sauce. Dessert was great doughnuts were outstanding. Martinis were good as well. Having read previous reviews we were disappointed.

Everyone who helped us was not very friendly. Another problem was the food and the ambiance. The exception--the minestrone (not sure of spelling--vegetable soup) was very good. We would not return there.

This restaurant really needs to work on its service. Some major attitude going on there. Food okay but not what I remember from

food was great; service was less than.

Great server, great food, great view! We will not return, however, because of the noise - much too loud. The Theatre Special was a great value!
Waited 30 min for a hamburger but it was very tasty. $13 for a very good burger.
We had a very nice dinner and the food was bad. We sat upstairs for the first time and that was a nice space. We will go back sometime and just enjoy the bar.
Had not been there in some time. Very disappointed with food but service was on point.
Great location, beautiful views but mediocre food and service. Bummer.
Great food - not very attentive or friendly staff.

Food: Pasta overcooked, tomato sauce overpowering, unable to to taste spices.

Overall: Enjoyed dinner.
Wine seemed relatively expensive-. The ambiance was nice though

Ordered roast leg of lamb.
Wonderful spot, bad comfort food. All the breads are over cooked, and the pig in a poke was horrible. Stumptown coffee, and glazed donuts to boot! Will definitely return..
Menu and food was excellent. Service was unbelievably slow and second rate.
Food was very good. Do not like tables for 2 where one person has to stare at the wall with back to the rest of the room.
Food was very tasty, but presentation was not creative. Felt like we were being rushed.

was ok
OK!
JUST OK
wine service good
not the bottle listed on the menu, sadly.
server was very polite and made themselves available all the time
agreed with our wine selection!
Food was good but for the price I expected better. The mood in the building was dark and unsettling.
Overall enjoyed the food but the service was painfully slow and we had to repeatedly remind the server for our drinks.
Very Pricey!! Noisey table next to us ruined our dinner!!! Service was too rushed and they were busy. All in all not my best experience but I will go again.

My boyfriend had entertained for business there before and thought it was ok. But, at my birthday celebration my son and I found the food only fair, and certainly not worth the expense. The band was playing but at the perfect volume so we can hear one another.
Nothing too memorable, but nice decor. Food was disappointing.
I had a huge fillet that was not cooked to perfection w/ potatoes and veggies for $19.00 ,great deal gotta try it..try the balsomic,carmel ice cream
Mediocre foo and a half hour wait after a reservation time would not encourage me to return. At least it was quiet inside.
The food was nicely presented and fresh. Seasoning was on point. It was our first time there and it seemed if you weren't a regular no one paid attention to you. Won't go back again!!!!!

Great space. Attentive staff. but Too noisy. Food was average at best.

Noise level: quiet and enjoyable.
Overall: Enjoyed dinner.
Very average at best food. The best thing on the menu is the mac n cheese...delisshhhh!

Disappointing for foodies who were expecting more from Jean -Georges trained talent It was nicely decorated and updated.

love the farm to table concept but the menu was very limited and not well executed. the food was well salted

Too loud and rushed but food was delicious.

Nice patio. It was very over priced.

Neat set up in the warehouse. Bad service, very loud & smoky but food was great.
sometimes it's great, sometimes not that good.

Before theatre dining very noisy,  salt used to season the food perfectly.

good food; way too crowded-tables elbow to elbow and too loud to have a conversation. The waitress could not take a spoken order-I had to yell it to her.

The food was good but it didn't worth the price we paid for it.

food was delicious. The service was very slow.

Overall decent experience. Not somewhere to go for a quiet dinner. Bad atmosphere for a group. Apps were good, entrees were average at best...

Very disappointed in teh Lobster entrees - would not recommend them. Appetizer sampler recommeded by the waiter was very good. I was also pleasantly surprised by the low noise level of the place.
None of the "Special Features" above apply. I've been there twice. Likely won't go again. Food was great though.

management agreed.
ok neighborhood restaurant nothing special. The recommended menu was good though.

Ok food for high price.
Service friendly and good but lacked menu knowledge.
The food was very mediocre
Stale food, service and atmosphere. Scallop dish was outstanding as was the apple dessert and caesar salad. We were first timers that will be back with friends.

A lively, fun place, with good, reasonably priced food! Too bad about the waitstaff!
Wonderful meal with 88 year old mother On Mother's Day! The interior is outdated, which means the atmosphere isn't great.
Entrees and menu for dinner was excellent. Need to improve on deserts. Just average. The dining room was stuffy and unwelcoming.

thye try to get everyone to sit at really great chairs and tables, till you prove you are not willing o do dso. after that food's ok, srvice too, but its still eating at a mall and they still treat you like yokels

Nothing special..like a Bennigan's. The 15 yr old chose this. But he loved the food.
Quiet atmosphere and food is consistently good although the portions and selections have decreased over the years to the point where the price in too high for the quantity and quality of the food.
Been to this restaurant many times.
food very good service very poor

The food was good. The wine list was good. Plus the service was very attentiative. I liked that they had the bread on the table wrapped in paper. It was very casual and I expected more from Batali/Bastianich.
Ambiance were excellent. The food, however, was just okay. Not bad, but not terrific like we expected. Would we go back? Maybe, after we explored other BYOB's in the area.

Service and food was mediocre at best.
Ho-hum and hopelessly mediocre. Too many good places in nearby Wash Park and Cherry Creek to bother with going back. Food was great though and the place was empty at 8pm on a Friday night.
The service was terrible, but the food was very good.
Knowing upfront they don't take any plastic other than amex and lack a liquor license would be a real treat for the next guest. I'll give it another try because of the charming ambience.
Food was good, noise level was good, disappointed by the service.
Good brunch deal, but food is a bit bland. Friendly service. Patio area is nice but a little rough around the edges, ie there was an old sconce behind my head that I hit a few times. A bit noisy.

Just visiting Baltimore and found this restaurant via Zagat. I was traveling alone for work, and had a tasty meal with not so great service.
the hostess and wait staff were friendly  and attentive. Got the right order and food just OK. I like this restayrant was was very disappointed.

FOOD IS GOOD NOT GRETA SERVICE IS VERY GOOD HOSTESS , WELL NEEDS A LITTLE HELP IN CUSTOMER SERVICE. Music is way too loud!

consistently poor food but great cocktails. the downside is that the wine list is a little pricey and they won't let you BYOB. otherwise a good place that never lets me down.

An upscale "Fridays". Very disappointing, definitely not a "date night" restaurant. Wait staff was nice and attentive.

Disappointing ambiance: incredibly cheesy, cliched Valentine's day experience.

Food was great and spectacular.

great beer selection, french fries but the service was horrendous.

Great service, but the high level of noise from the bar area made it nearly impossible to hold a conversation at our table.

This isn't a dining experience that we will be repeating.
This restaurant wasn't loud. The food was very good but we literally could not speak to each other. Don't ruin your night.
Excellent food and crappy atmosphere. Definitely will go there again.

The food was great but overpriced for the poor service.

traditional menu.

average, very overpriced food. excellent service and ambiance. would have been highly rated if it cost a hundred dollars less.

Tables fairly close together.

not so great service and great food. Overall just an okay experience.

way too expensive

tourists trap

at least the food was good.

Mediocre food at reasonable prices. Nice quiet patio in Old Town La Quinta. OK for lunch - not good for dinner.

My steak was incredible but my wifes scallops were fishy and rank. stay away from the scallops.
food was great. service was not. not helpful at all adn took very long time to pay attention to our table.

The restaurant not as good as the last time we went.

Food was okay.

service very responsive. Lobster special not very good

Service is OK.
Food was okay. Due to the fact that the food wasn't exceptional we won't return.

wine list is great; pasta not so good.

Lovely atmosphere, and the food is great. Too bad the service was mediocre.

Mediocre at best. Way too much oil on food. Waiters were extremely nice and quick with taking our orders however.
Service was so FAST!!!!! It took less than 15 minutes to get 4 sandwiches on a Thursday night. It wasn't as if the restaurant was busy. Food was just ok.
Overall, it was very good. Must say we like the desserts best. The burger looked tasty but was tough and chewy, may try it again next time with another dessert.

Good bread and their beer was cold and the it was cozy and inviting inside - I'm choosing not to remember the rest.

It was my first time at Cyrano's and I must say that I would be impressed if it wasn't so loud and dirty in the restaurant!! The service is outstanding and the menu is impressive though. I might come back soon!!
our second time at Zocco - really enjoyed the wine, riverwalk view and excellent service, while the food was subpar!
A good Italian restaurant in Atlanta. Just needs a better ambiance, it does not feel welcoming.
The bar was nice, the food OK. The price, high.
Really nice service but they pack a lot of tables in and, sadly, the past special wasn't so great. Very nice $25 wine list.
As always, great food, but bad service, you are rushed to finish meal.

The food was excellent and the place was so loud 
but the waiters were not very friendly.
There are a lot better taverns in the city than this one. The menu was pretty limited and the food was good, but not great.
Good food, but it took over an hour to get our food... and it was not very crowded.
Great food. Terrible atmosphere. Fancy pants.
Overall I would rate this restaurant fair at best. The food was average, the dining room was loud, the experience with the wait staff was very impersonal.

Server was an amateur. Food, well...MMMMMMMMmmmmmmmm.
Love the proximity to the Fox.
I keep wishing their food were better and the noise level were just a bit lower. It's not a good place to go if you really want to talk with friends but the service is good at least.
out of four meals, three would reccommend theirs to a friend or order again. Did not like the outdoor atmosphere!

The food was ok, and the service was warm

Food okay but not what I remember from
Michel Richard.

over rated. Fish selection is minimal. Skate? come on! Trash fish. Manager was nice though and food was at least good. I normally have to send my steak back but here it was done perfectly. Glad they know that MR means med-rare not well done.
Everything was so nice but the drink prices are ridiculously high and the table lights were way too dim.
the food was good service unbelieveable slow I think there was one waiter even had trouble getting a bottle of wine. Pleasantly quiet- food was good but two orders were not cooked as ordered.
Our experience at this restaurant was fair.The service was very good and the server was quite attendant.The food was also very good.The outside space is very noisy.We will not return.

Good food, but very spotty service and loud noise makes me leery of returning to Harvard Sq. location.

The food I had was the french onion soup and other food.

Rude Service.Un friendly Staff. Excellent food made up for it.
I felt I overpaid for the food that I received, The taste was outstanding, but not worth the price, and the serving size was very small, but the ambiance was nice..

Good Waiter and not too loud, but very bad manager!
The service was really rude and snobbish and definitely not recommendable. On the other hand, the food was exceptional.

The food itself was ok.

Places like this can make you feel very elite - This one has more of a pedestrian feel to it.
Thought it was a bit overpriced.
The food was very lacking and the atmosphere was kind of dull. It was a relatively quiet night so I might have felt differently had it been busier.
Hae been here a few times and it is just okay - Entrees and wine list a bit pricey for what it is. Food comes out on time.
great food even though it was a little pricey for what you are getting, Amazing service, no wonder it lost its michelin star
average, very adequate food. excellent service. would have been highly rated if it cost a hundred dollars less.

just okay food for the price. service staff do not have it together yet.
It's gone downhill. Bad service, but excellent food.
Great setting and crowd. Food and service were very disappointing. Not worth the high prices.

Decent food. It is an ok fall back when looking for a place that takes reservations...
Old style Italian food

Wife had leftovers.

The service and food was excellent, portion sizes were could not have been better. Ambiance needs some work, could have been much better.
The pricing was a little to the high side.

Beautiful place, however, I don't think I will be able to convince my family to go back as the sevice was, at best, poor... :(

Service a little to casual (just matter of fact).
service was very spotty, server was berating the the expediter at our table, not nice. I ordered the braised meats with sunday gravy.

service was great. Food was oversalted. The place was super hot....
wonderful food. fair value for location. service disorganized

Although we requested downstairs, they couldn't seat us there without a wait. Although upstairs is quieter, the service is much faster
since food must be brought upstairs. Waiters are very nice..

liked the restaurant a lot but didn't love the meal. Found the chicken salty. Loved the ambiance of the place though.

food okay . Cocktail menu skimpy

a restauarant.

Food was very good.
wine service poor
not the bottle listed on the menu, sadly.
server was very arrogant and never around.
disputed our wine selection!

very average food. Ruth Chris kills it.

overall... it was okay. i recommend for special occasions, the chill vibe and beautiful dining room make up for the food.

Pasta and Calamari, A little with dessert.

nice dinner with but service and attention to detail was horrible!

A bit disappointing.
service is never good here but the food is cheap and tasty and the feeling there is comfortable. Definitely not worth waiting for but if you can walk in go for it.

We arrived on Sunday night and they were out of just about everything. The place was quiet at least. Will they still be here in 6 months???

very decent food but not exciting; good atmosphere (though was uncrowded due to weather); however, we experienced somewhat slow and disrespectful service. Nothing terribly wrong, reasonably priced, but nothing particularly distinctive, either.
The Pollo al Limone was dry, and not very satifying. The Trittico di Pasta was extremely small in portion. The noise was perfect and the food was tasty, but the portion size was definitely lacking.
Great food, but surprisingly bad ambiance and decor, considering it is below ground level.
The wait staff was terrible! The food we had was very good but all 3 dishes were a little too salty.

Server was a delight. Food, well...not so much.
Love the proximity to the Fox.

Dining experience was kind of rushed. They were serving Mother's Day special menu and our entrees came out even before we got started on our appetizers. Decor was beautiful and in theme with Mother's Day. The food was nothing special - lacked flavor.
This is the first time I had eaten lunch at the Cafe. The food was wonderful, but the service was slow.
food was ok only because the two of us paid over a $100 and didn't even get a single drink - I would've been better off at. The atmosphere was superb though.
This restaurant was INCREDIBLY loud. The food was very good but we literally could not speak to each other. Don't ruin your night.
Service and hospitality were terrible. Food was creatively prepared and tasted great. Food choices are varied and interesting. It was a good experience overall.
empty room at Monday lunch......meal was well portioned and tasty....won't return
Food was pricey for the quality. Not great. Service was excellent though. Better for an after-dinner dessert/drink.
food was really good and the atmosphere was bad. Very nice wine selection-prices were decent too.
Not much to brag about here. Just average to fair Italian food and it was too loud. Cheap wine list, full of California "B" level wines. The one very good item was the house made bread.
Terrible ambiance but food was awesome, will definately not be back.
They had the best lemonade and great dessert, but the food was average. They boast of the 2 guys from Italy with a special menu and it's warranted!
There are many better restaurants in SF. I see no reason to go back to this one other than the great food.
Mid-evil themed restaurant with a decent prix fixe dinner menu for the value, but probably better suited to older tourists vs. SF locals
Food was not good but had reasonable prices--Monday & Tuesday wine special-$10 per bottle is a favorite--
Decent food, not worth the price or the hype.
the food was good. I liked it but fear my husband won't want to go back!
Makes going to the opera easy! Food is adequate - nothing special. Appetizers are literally (one) bite-sized. At least the noise level here is fine.
A little too expensive for the quality of the food which is good to very good. Service is slow and unresponsive to deadlines.
Love the buzz but not the food at Marcella's. We're budget-minded and find this a poor place to spend more than our usual (low) allowance to treat ourselves.

The room was noisier than I would have liked, but the decor and vibe was nice. I asked for the veal chop medium and it was rare toward the center; in the end I left quite a bit of it. One of my companions rated his dinner
The food is not outstanding. The ambiance is romantic. The service is fun and professional.
Very nice ambiance. The food was okay, but not worth the prices charged, IMHO. City Table *did* introduce me to a fine Pinot Noir, however -- the 2008 Hob Nob. Loved it!
Too noisy. Had to shout across the table. Impressed by big portions but quality of food is mediocre.
Awful front desk girl...what a sour puss!  The decor and food were great though.

Seems to have gone down hill since our last visit. The tiramasu was still outstanding the rest of the food was nothing special and my favorite antipasto platter was no longer available. Too bad ! The service was also up to par.
I really enjoyed the food , but the waitress was awful!
The tables were a bit too close together for an intimate valentine's day meal. A bit noisy too. But the food and service was great.

The Sunday Jazz Brunch isn't that great - The music is good, but the food is bland and not very creative. The ambiance is quiet, but not so quite as to inhibit conversation. A wonderful way to spend an early Sunday afternoon.
It wasn't as good as it usually is but service was good as always.

Nice vibrant lunch spot in the Financial district.
Good authentic Ital. menu with some great choices foir lunch.
But the service takes forever and is not good.
Food is fabulous...but upstairs is social Siberia. Which would be fine, if it weren't such a grim space. Can't they tart it up a bit?
living of their location and history. beautiful space but the food seemed to prepared on assembly line
food was disappointing and restaurant was quiet, and felt very comfortable and warm.
bland, uninspired, mediocre food with a nice atmosphere.
This is my favorite restaurant in Orange County but the food is not great.
My dining experince was excellent even thought the food was bad
The food was average, nothing special. Tastes were bland, nothing savory or memorable.  At least the place looked nice.
Quality of Food was equal to the price of the meal.
Love the food, the service, but find the tables too close together and a little noisy.
It was not unpleasant. It was a nice and quiet place to eat but with all the outstanding restaurants around the neighborhood, this would not be one we will return to.
The worst food the best service. Thanks Rich!

The food and service were excellent.
The Chef is shy but obviously cares about the food and its preparation. However, the restaurant was way too loud since there was a live band playing.
we order tuna tha was on a special menu
This restaurant is okay. Very pretty but food was mediocre. This was my first visit but I would give it another change. The service was good, very attentive and accommodating.
Overpriced food, but the service was good and responsive management with great ambiance. So go and sit on the deck and order cocktails and snacks...but if you want dinner on the water go elsewhere.
Stale food, just remember that it is not American pizza. Wait staff was very prompt and pleasant.
Been there many times.
Valentines Day dinner was truly a great meal but the noise was loud
Food was fine.
Kitschy and touristy. A bit pricey for the quality. Service was amazing and very attentive. This place definitely gets by on it's claim as the best restaurant in the US.
I was looking forward to taste galettes, but they didn't taste anything like the ones I ate in Paris. The service was excellent and very knowledgeable.
Nothing too memorable.
The service was good. Very pleasant and attentive waiters. the food were very average.
Previous people had said the place was romantic. It was not romantic. The service was slow and unpleasant. The food was great.

Okay evening with another couple. Our server was very bad, not letting us enjoy conversation and cocktails before ordering and rushing us. Our dinners were delicious however. We will probably be back.
Food was so-so, my spinach salad was very bland save the skirt steak. Certainly a let down apart from the great service.
We go to a lot of tasting menus in the city. This one was great but not our favorite. The waiters are incredible!
There are a lot better taverns in the city than this one. The menu was pretty limited and the food was good, but not great. Service was good.
Previous people had said the place was romantic. It was too loud to be romantic. The service was efficient and fast paced. The food was great.
Great Experience. Unbelievably bad atmosphere!
Nothing special. The 15 yr old chose this.
Beautiful place, great views, wonderful food, poor service. Maybe worth a return visit.
Interesting food, meh service, great wine list, rather noisy and somewhat overpriced
A little too expensive for the quality of the food which is good to very good.
Service and atmosphere were both fine, but the food was just mediocre. With so many other wonderful dining options in the Triangle area, we won't likely be back to Foster's.
An hour's wait after the confirmed reservation time, but well handled by staff.
The food was good but the drinks are overpriced.

A very tired Boston institution. Short of wait staff, but the number of captains, watching you wait was unbelievable. Loved it 30 years ago, but it's old and tired. Definitely not worth the price, but the food is consistently good, which keeps us coming back.
Everything was fantastic until the music started. WAY too loud. So I gave ambiance, overall, and noise (calling it energetic is much too kind) a not so hot rating....However, our server was great.

Food was good and service has improved since my last visit, but the ambiance is still bad. I would recommend expanding the desert menu. With the limited options we actually went somewhere else for desert.
Went for Mothers Day Brunch. waitstaff did not know the menu. Great views.
Food was plain to okay. Wine prices were HIGH. The only good thing was it was nice and quiet  where we can talk to each other without yelling. A one time restuarant. No reason to go back
ok for a pre-theater meal but nothing special. Service was very slow.
They offer wines by the glass for several of their wines, but offer a limited variety of reds. For example, they had no red zinfandel's by the glass. Service was slow.
We went to this restaurant because it is one of Chef Mario's. The food was fine..not great. We won't make a second trip to Otto.
Food was delicious, but overpriced. This place seems more interested in being a club/bar than a restaurant.
The french toast and pan cakes seemed not to deserve its price but the atmosphere was chill and laid back

i reserved a dinner for our anniversary and it was really as i targetted. my wife found it very romantic at first. we enjoyed the great food and but the service was just too slow. Not a perfect place for romantic dinners.

clueless service--waiter couldn't make informed suggestion--martinis served in champagne flutes (after 20 minute wait)--kept trying to speed us through dinner. Only thing I liked was the music. Perfect volume for dinner.
Average service, average food. If you don't have anything better...

This is our favorite French Restaurant in the Denver area. The food is fantastic, the ambiance isn't that great because it's so loud inside, and the service is top-knotch. Try it - you won't be disappointed!
The quality of the service is always consistant.
Our food and the service were excellent. I would recommend it to anyone who doesnt mind a bad view.
Great time, good service food was good, price was right! But it was too noisy I`d likely back again!
Building was run down , service was extremely attentive, food was exquisite and very reasonably priced. A truly superb experience.
The food was ok. I thought it would be better for the prices. They had a band playing and they were fantastic. The noise level was perfect for the atmosphere.
Awesome meal and staff. Attention to detail fantastic. Highly Recommended other than how loud the restaurant was.
One of the best meals I have ever had even though it was quite noisy.
It's never very loud -- laid back atmoshphere. Not necessarily a bad thing, but something you want to be aware of before you go.
I have been at your restaurant three times in the last two weeks.
Food was great and the atmosphere was nice and quiet. It was awesome! Great place!

consistently great food and cocktails. the ONLY downside is that the wine list is a little pricey and they won't let you BYOB and the ambinace was bad. otherwise an outstanding place that never lets me down.
Decent menu, relatively well executed, served by largely wonderful hotel staff
This resturant is a delight. Very pretty and food is great. This was my first visit and I am definitely going back. The service was slow, not very attentive or accomodating.
Perfect in all ways besides the noise level, especially for pre-theater dinner.

The food and service was very good, but it was too noisy. My wife and I enjoyed a very nice dinner she had the Ahi Tuna and truelly enjoyed it, and my dish was very good also, but I will try something different next time.
Food and service were excellent. We will return soon, provided it isn't so noisy next time.

One of the best Italian meals I have ever eaten. Each course was better than the next. Ingredients for the food were excellent. My only beef with the place was that it was too loud to hear each other talk.

The food was just okay.
It wasn't great. Great location, okay food.
Don't eat the cashew crusted Mahi Mahi.
It was a salt and fat plate. Stick with the wood
grilled food. Presentation was very good. Service was great.
I'm just sorry I forgot her name, but we did tip her well.
Portions were very generous and all the food was very tasty. Only drawback was the rude hostess.
Not too noisy, a great place to go for a conversation or romantic meal, as it had been on our last visit .Background music not too intrusive.
Just visiting Baltimore and found this restaurant via Zagat. I was traveling alone for work, great service.
My dining experience was wonderful, with just the right amount of noise, I look forward to dining there in the near future.
Sentence: Food was "good" and reasonably priced. Service was attentive.
Food was delicious and not overpriced. Portions were perfect.
Once again our group had an excellent evening
Good food easy for downtown play timing
Fantastic food in an unrushed atmosphere. The restaurant was a bit loud though
As always this was a great experience, despite the drab ambiance. Food was excellent and well presented. Good value for the money!!!
My wife and I went for a Valentine's Day dinner. We very much enjoyed the food, especially the steak. In addition, the service was friendly and attentive. However, the ambiance was a bit rundown...
Still consistently great food. A gem. Note, it can get very loud on weekends.
I enjoy the food. I always enjoy the waiters. The ambiance was a bit drab though.
A welcome addition to the Heights dining scene. I found the menu to be a bit restricted; I would have liked more choices or maybe some side options.
Was not thrilled be new menu, we enjoyed the previous menu selections. Service was slow,we were there for a pre show dinner, we arrived 2 hours prior and did not have time for dessert.
Delightful atmosphere, not too loud. Great place to relax before or after a tour of the CIA. Great breads. Small portion sizes.
The food and wine was perfect the atmosphere was ruined but the great service made up for it.

We had an awesome meal. I ate at Craftsteak and was somewhat disappointed and was somewhat reluctant to try Craft. It was too loud and I could barely hear our server. However, this restuarant was everything you can ask for. We highly recommend it.
Piatti is always good...and sometimes it is very good.
This is my favorite restaurant although noisy  in Orange County
We enjoyed our evening out celebrating Valentine's Day early. The theater crowd had just left. The new menu was fun to explore.
Simply put it was perfectly quiet, It is the designers fault, the acoustics are great. It was not a question of quiet music. Everyone was able to speak normally at their dinner companions.
it was very good.
Lovely restaurant. Great service. Only ambiance was average. Huge burger was $5. Great value
The last great classic French restaurant in Manhattan, but it gets very loud.

This is our 2nd time and the restaurant, food and service was excellent. The only bad thing is it can get too loud to have a conversation. Looking forward to going there again when I am in New Haven, CT.

Having changed hands so often one never knows what to expect, but service was charming and food excellent this time, and the view is incomparable. Only downside was poor choice of music which was way too loud.
Cowboy benny was on the bland side, but chef's healthy breakfast was very good. Server was good and kitchen was able to pump out dishes very quickly.
Deafeningly loud. Food was great.
the bread was exceptional.
The seafood is phenomenal, and the complimentary peanut brittle by the entrance is so yummy! The ambiance could use some work though

The times I've went to Lazy Goat, they've never let me down, except this time. The food was less than tasty, but the atmosphere was good, prices are good. All around a good place to go in downtown greenville.
The service was above average and the place is beautiful and food was good.  But I wouldn't go back.
Ol' reliable when attending events at Lincoln Center. Salads and soups are great for a light meal, as is the antipasto bar. Steaks, fish and pastas always fresh and tasty.
Good food, and it took only 10 minutes to get our food... and it was not very crowded.
The restaurant is high quality but a bit pricey for the limited menu they offer. The music wasn't too loud and was perfect.
Service is friendly. Ingredients are fresh. Wine by the glass program could be expanded and/or rotated. Good neighborhood spot.
The service was not great but, always our top choice in Ann Arbor....for years and years.
Enjoyed the surroundings.
Good food - good service. Extremely loud and hard to hear.
Warm Mushroom Soup and Seared Scallops were both too salty. Most memorable service. I will be returning to give the tasting menu a try though.
The food was good as usual.
It was very nice. The food was wonderful and so was the service! Noise levels were favorable, was a relaxing experience.
One of the bestPrix Fixe choices and values we have seen. Service pleasant but slow and the food was interesting.
Excellent experience! Remains our favorite San Francisco restaurant but they need to close the windows due to the outside noise.
Food was good and so was the service.
The lighting was perfect which made it easy to read the menu.
The restaurant is high quality but a bit pricey for the limited menu they offer. Food was outstanding
My wife and I ate at La Tavola while on a trip to Atlanta last weekend. I had not eaten there since the change in ownership, and both the menu and service have introduced noticeable upgrades since.
The tables were spaced well for an intimate valentine's day meal. A bit noisy though. But the food and service was great.
food very good
Excellent food, fabulous cocktails, accommodating staff, too much noise due to tables being too close, however.
The service was great. Our waiter was very patient and even took some pictures for us. The food was also wonderful although I was saddened to find there was no ravioli on the menu.
The food, service and attention to detail were excellent. This is a wonderful restaurant, however I wish there was a better view.
great food; byob presently we will be back soon!
Will definitely go back.
Really good Italian. slow service, great for a leisurely business lunch / dinner.
Meal was fabulous. Definitely recommend their tasting menus - a great value. Also the recommended new Italian wines at the beginning of the wine list are excellent. With is was quieter.
The champagne cocktails are good.
We loved our lunch at Chops. The food selection was wonderful.
Sat downstairs next to bar. Fun table. Excellent waiter Nathan. Perfect suggestions and excellent wine choice. Music a bit loud.
Fantastic food in an unrushed atmosphere. "Right" portioned. Possibly slightly overpriced for the portions, but still a very nice experience. Worth the visit though.
Great local menu and knowledgeable staff. Would like a more expansive wine list.
Sat downstairs next to bar. Fun table.  Food was spectacular! Music a bit loud.
Service was good, we got seated right away. We order drinks and appetizers and a pizza.

Our server Nikki was the best! She was profession as well as friendly and personal. We have found that each time we have visited Cafe Roma that our experience has been better than the last. Bravo! Despite this the music was too loud and the decor was bland.
Everything was great but it was very loud! Still one of our Top Three in San Diego
The food was good. However, it could use some improvement. The noise level was outstanding.
Terrible ambiance, but food was awesome, will definately be back.
We had steak and the lamb shank. Both were excellent. Too noisy.
We had a great time, good food and great service, but had a hard time hearing each other. The restaurant is one of our favorites in the Sacramento area.

The service, food, ambience was excelelnt, portion sizes were could not have been better.
The pricing was a little to the high side. Very quiet, nice place for romantic dinner.
Brought my parents to celebrate mother's birthday. Everyone loved the food, which is not always the case with such a picky father! However, the service was very slow.
The menu was limited but intriguing. The Bistro salad was quite good. The mushroom ravioli excellent and up to expectations.
Excellent....as always! Will always return but the service needs to be better before i do.
We got seated right away...Hostess as well as wait staff were very on top of things. Hard not to like it after that!
One of the top places to dine in Las Vegas. The food is excellent - the view is to die for, but the service leaves much to be desired.
This was my first time dining at Pace and the overall experience was wonderful. We had a very mundane, boring evening but the food was incredible! We will be back.... a lot!
Wonderful food, new so they are still working out service issues. Were seated next to a table of noisy children. Worth going back though!
As always, we had a great time. Martini's were excellent! Food was dry and overcooked! Service was good.
We have eaten at Aperto many times. This time, however, the brunch was so much better with a tasty omelette, spicy potatoes and the food was hot. Next time, I'll stick with the pasta.
Nice service, and the food just was very good.
Special treat to go the Tosca Ristorante, although the service isn't good.
Good food but service was not great. Great table location right in front of the window with pleasing decor.
Food was great and no entrees were over cooked. Our server was sweet, though overwhelmed. Will be returning.

Outstanding dining experience. Can't wait til I'm in town again, will definitely go have dinner again at this place. The Lamb Shank was the best I've ever eaten. It was not romantic like most of the reviews mentioned though, I thought the decor was cheap looking.
The chef is in LOVE with pepper flakes. Should have dish descriptions accurately point this out. Some items very spicy and I love them.
It was so quiet that it was possible to talk to my wife without raising my voice.
Overall it was pretty good. We enjoyed the food and the lively atmosphere.
I've been there a couple of times before and I liked it. I think I'll go back because the ambiance was romantic and cozy and the noise level was very low.
The Restaurant Week menus were available to everyone at the table who ordered it!

This is a great low key place right in the heart of Hollywood. Food was excellent yet priced fairly and the service was amazing. The atmosphere was a little too proper for my taste.   Will not be back
We had a lovely experience, very rude service but good food!
The experience was excellant other than the abrasive atmosphere, would very much go again.
Decent food, and service was very fast. It is an ok fall back when looking for a place that takes reservations...
Very nice looking place. Front door staff was very charming and accomodating. Server was mediocre at best. Food was amazing as worth the price

The service was great and atmosphere quiet. Our waiter was very patient and even took some pictures for us. The food was also wonderful although I was saddened to find there was no ravioli on the menu.
food was good food was warm when server arrived at the table.
had a huge fillet that was cooked to perfection w/ potatoes and veggies for $19.00 ,great deal gotta try it..try the balsomic,carmel ice cream. Just too noisey.

the food was awesome and the service was outstanding. great place to dine. best time is during happy hour get half price on raw bar. recommend this highly. however do not reccommend the sushi there. It's nice and peaceful inside because it's located near the water.
We enjoyed our evening out celebrating Valentine's Day early. The theater crowd had just left and the restaurant was quieter than during our last visit.
The service was great, as was the food. I think I will go back there to eat again.
Great for theatre...really loud...food was good and the waiter was always available.
Always dependably good food and service.
The food was great, service was slow and was a great place to enjoy a great meal.
It was my first time at Cyrano's and I must say that I'm mostly impressed!! The service is outstanding but the menu is limited and unimpressive. I'm probably coming back soon!!
Their Valentine's Day Prix fixe conference call was reasonably priced for the excellent quality of food. We were disappointed in the wine list,though. Great decor and we enjoyed the jazz.
The food was great,its very relaxing. It was overall good.
Noisy, no place to go for a conversation or romantic meal, as it had been on our last visit .Background music too intrusive. The food was to die for, however.
Very nice, friendly, comfortable Italian restaurant in a rennovated adobe home.waiter seemed a little inexperienced, but was very attentive. Nice, casual place. Would return.
i have been to centro before and enjoyed it. typically solid. service was good without problem. ordered cheese and meat tray which was very tasty. will try restaurant again, nonetheless.
Excellent ambiance. My clients enjoyed the meal very much.
LOVE Otto!! Everyone could not say enough about how delicious the food and wine was! The service was bad though.
This was our first visit to eat at Il Cortile (had been there for a drink at the bar once before). The food was FABULOUS, as was the service, but the nosie could be a little grating.
Love the high quality food and consistently excellent service at a moderate price. it is a restaurant I return to again and again horrible ambiance though
Food and service are outstanding. Ambiance is lacking though. Regardless, cannot wait to go back.

Very good food and service. Scenic view of Columbus Circle and
Central Park West. Only negative was that it is very loud and difficult
to hold a coversation.
Food was good.
Really good Italian. great for a business lunch / dinner.
They could be living of their location and history, but the food was great, too!
It was my husbands birthday and they treated us like royalty! Food was delicious and service was great! The place was very unusually loud but it is still one of our fav's :)
Excellent service. Great for a special night out.
My husband and I met a couple of friends for dinner, and had a wonderful evening. We will be dining there again, the atmosphere was the only downside.
We had a delightful time. The food wasn't interesting and the wine delicious. The waiter was very professional and attentive. Thoroughly enjoyed the experience though.
Our server was delightful. The food was magnificent. The prices seemed right for the type of food that was being served. The wine and martini were sub par for the price.
Love your restaurant and the food is the best. Wouldn't go with a big group because of the noise level, but for a table of 2 it's fine. (I have a mild hearing loss)

I LOVE THIS PLACE. best food. best people. the tiramisu is to die for as is the cheesecake, the pasta is all homemade, and the staff is incredibly friendly. Interior is ugly, however, making for less than great atmosphere.
Delicious food. Great location in beautiful hotel although it was a bit dark and quiet in there.
Went to TH for an anniversary dinner and really enjoyed it. The food was great, and ambiance was lively, but the service was a bit poor.

The experience was everything I expected it to be from Ciao's. Their food and service was stellar as has always been my experience with them. I will continue to come back again and again even though it is way too noisy in there.
Very Pricey!! Quiet, chilled out atmosphere that was really enjoyable. Service was good and they were busy. I will go again.

Keeps getting better and better. One of the most attractive environments around. Not too noisy. Great location for pre-theater dining. Only reservation:wine list too heavily skewed to very expensive offerings.
I liked the experience of visiting the oldest restaurant in USA.
The pasta dishes were great. All the seafood dishes were well prepared. All-in-all a reliable choice and good for pre-theater although the service was slow

Awesome restaurant, the service was outstanding, we had a party of 20 and they accomodated us efficiently. Food was fast and accurate and staff was patient and pleasant in spite of the jarring ambiance.
I selected this restaurant because I thought it would be a good place for a business meeting. You met my expectations. Quiet and relaxing. Thanks.
Even though it is located in a strip mall, once inside the diner forgets that. The surroundings are less than acceptable, the service impeccable and the food delicious!
This was a pleasant surprise for us. There were 3 in our party, there were many choices of foods of interest for us, in fact it was hard to choose. We will return. Wish the views were nicer though.
It's been 3 years since I went for Sat brunch. Still decent value, though.

Very accommodating. The price fixe appetizer and entree were excellent. The dessert chocolate almond tarte was not tasteful at all. Stay with the savory items at this place. I could hear my soft spoken grandma with no issues.
Building was delightful, service was not attentive, food was exquisite and very reasonably priced. An almost truly superb experience.
We had a terrific time for our 39th Wedding Anniversary. Thanks a lot! If I had any surprise, it was that we were not comp-ed for our dessert as an Anniversary gift from you.
lots of potential at this place.. a few tweeks, mainly ambiance, and you may have a winner.
The food was fine, but our server made the experience even better.
Our waiter was great.
One our favorite spots in D.C. The service is friendly and the atomsphere is vibrant. Tables are a bit close.
The food was average, but the service was awesome.
Piedmonte and Umbia come to life at Pelago. Service is outstanding and the creations are impeccable, but the dining room is dingy and looks old-fashioned in a bad way.
Food was so good. Fairly priced for the quality of the food. Will go back.
Always great food! The Monday night roast chicken special is amazing, but it was a bit too loud. And you get to take home all the fixins to make a great chicken stock! Will definitely return soon!
I think the service lived up to the reviews it received. did meet my expectations.
Great service and the food was excellent! Recommend trying the specials for lunch. The ambiance was a bit off though.
the atmosphere was nice and very quiet when we dined there the other evening.
Not bad, met the hype. Such large portions.
Very noisy but overall a very good experience. Seafood with pasta was outstanding.
We had a wonderful time. Two of us got the prix fixe, two not. Our guests who have not been here before were most complimentary. Despite lackluster service, we will of course be back.
Interesting place. We were very surprised with how good the food was. I would go back.  The service was a bit slow though.
The Sunday special of lobster, potatoes and corn was a good deal. They could forget about the corn, but as usual the rest of the food was excellent. The ambiance was perfect
The food and the service were at the level that I was expecting for a restaurant that is owned by a renowned chef. Excellent noise level in dining area.
Great for a delicious supper before the symphony - especially with the help of valet parking.
Great all around service.
This is the first time I had eaten lunch at the Cafe. The food was wonderful, and the service was excellent. Dated decor though
We were thrilled to learn that Cafe Du Parc was open for dinner on the night of the 2010 blizzard when everyone else was closed. The service was absolutely exceptional, but the food was just alright.
pancetta pizza was good, shrimp was very avg, asparagus was good, service (food) was fast but it was before a sharks game so everyone probably ordered at the same time
Food and Service were fantastic but the decor is greatly lacking. Furniture and ambiance was "cheap" compared to the high quality of the food.
excellent food and service but rather noisy, great for a special night out.
We order drinks and appetizers and a pizza, all were good!
Great Italian with a good wine list and reasonable prices... The service is always great both in the restaraunt and bar, but the music isn't good and is too loud.
had a huge fillet that was cooked to death w/ potatoes and veggies for $19.00 ,great deal gotta try it..try the balsomic,carmel ice cream
Absolutely loved the food. Second time going and the food is delicious. Subpar service and cool vibe...

Nice friendly staff, great mix of people. Food was outstanding.
Would recommand to all, a must try.
I'm going back as often as I can.
The bartendar was friendly and professional but it was too dark in there.
It was and always has been very relaxing here at all meal times.
Foo could be improved , service, and ambiance were all outstanding. Can't wait to go back again.
Great beer selection and great take on some comfort foods. The service was speedy.
Nice vibrant lunch spot in the Financial district.
Scones at brunch were incredible. Not to loud.
Good. The salads are great. Often when we've gone to Sette Bello, the service has been terrible. HOwever, this evening the service was quite good and the ambiance was agreeable.
Building was delightful, service was extremely attentive, food was exquisite and very reasonably priced. A truly superb experience, except for the noise.
Next time I'll keep my nightclub and dinning experiences the same as this time. The whole dinning inside a night club thing was really intriguing, fun and exciting.
My family and friends love food
Beautiful place, great views, wonderful food, service leaves something to be desired though. Definitely worth a return visit.
The food was very good. The restaurant itself could use some sprucing up, especially in the back of the house.
Great wine list. Very peaceful after work place. We ordered pasta dishes however when I return I would try more traditional bistro fare. The steaks looked great as did the burgers.
Really delicious Italian food, with fast, efficient service. Not necessarily a "special occasion"-type restaurant, but if I lived up in Santa Ynez, I'd come here every week.
It was great! Bitter food. Great service. Had a wonderful time.
Accomodating.
ambiance very good, only the clam appitizers were appealing,
I don't mind paying the higher food prices for dinner when they have entertainment, and the food is priced perfectly for lunch.
salads were very tasty and fresh, entrees were good.
Terrific salads and nice music make it worthwhile.
food was quite good. off the beaten track and pretty good value
Well-rounded menu, with an excellent wine list.
Inexpensive for what you get. The food here is Italian and it tastes great.
Gnochi was excellent as always, however, we waited 20 minutes with a reservation and the Chicken Picatta was very flavorful.
THE WAITRESS WAS VERY KNOWLEDGABLE!
The only downside is that the dessert menu didn't really entice me, but overall very good experience.
Disappointing. Went for Mother's Day Brunch. All of the servings were Amazing. Service was adequate but not what expected of a so called 5 star resort.
The service and atmosphere are very nice.
Excellent Valentine's menu. Excellent service and food. The decor was a bit drab, but would definitely recommend this restaurant and will return.
Food and service were excellent. Only complaint was that the lighting was too dark. We will return soon.
Great food, bad service, great atmosphere...a winning combination!
We are regulars and I was very impressed with the service.. We had an 8 p.m. curtain to make and while we did I had to get up to go pay the bill. Gave a short tip.
High end spot in the North End. Downstairs dining would have been fine on a busy nite-before-Mothers-Day. The ambiance was good
Excellent everything except the noise level. What a beautiful, garden setting.
The Sunday special of lobster, potatoes and corn was a good deal. They could forget about the corn, but as usual the rest of the food was excellent.
We have eaten here three times and each time the service was extremely efficient. Looks nice, but very noisy.
The food was great.
The food was great and the service was excellent in the beginning. After we received our main course, we hardly saw our waiter. Needs consistency in service and a little less noise.
Valuable money for perfectly cooked, fresh lobster.

The service was great. Our waiter was very patient and even took some pictures for us. The food was also wonderful although I was saddened to find there was no ravioli on the menu.  Too loud inside though.
The service and food were good.The view is great!
Great wine list. Very calm after work place. We ordered pasta dishes however when I return I would try more traditional bistro fare. The steaks looked great as did the burgers.
Food was very good.
Sat downstairs next to bar. Fun table. Excellent waiter Nathan. Perfect suggestions and excellent wine choice. Food was spectacular! Music a bit loud.
Great Ambiance. Top quality service. of our waiter. Other people were very attentive and helpful, and we really hoped the waiter would've been the same. it would've changed the whole experience.

The tables were fairly isolated - pretty romantic for Valentine's Day - we were essentailly on our own with the couples at the next table a good few feet away. The music was also nice and soft, and I was able to talk with my date.
limited menus-food well prepared and quite good
Expensive relative to the ratings I would assign each category, but the food was excellent
Great food, friendly staff, boring atmosphere. Would definitely return.
we had a new server and a busy nite... These people were trained quite well. Great service overall.
My friends and I shared several dishes from each section. Everything was amazing. I recommend it all except for the unfortunate decor choices!
I loved my dining experience. I felt as though I was treated as royalty. The environment was clean and relaxing. The food was not up to par though.
An experience all around! The food was not very good. The service was impeccable! We will defiantly come back.
Go there for the food, but stay for the style and atmosphere.
Second visit to this DC icon. Never disappointed. Will return when in town. However, service is very slow.
A quaint bistro off the usual circuit in Center City with a distinct, Mediterranean/Moroccan feel. Nice ambiance.
Food was good. Prices were reasonable and portions were good. Staff was very accommodating and friendly.
Crazy busy. 30 minute wait with a reservation. Good service while waiting at a bar table. Very loud. Waitress slammed, but still did a good job. Food was quite good.
What a great, quiet place for brunch on a beautiful day!
The service was slow, (do not know if it was the kitchen's fault or the waiters) but it was worth the wait. The food was remarkable and tasted perfect!
Atmosphere was fun; food was good. Not overpriced. Would definitely go back again for the food. Rotisserie chicken was moist; our whole party of seven was happy with the food. DJ's music was alright.
We love this restaurant. Lake Park Bistro is one of our all time favorites. But the decor could use an update.

It was good. I asked for steamed lobster and received backed stuffed. But it was still good (I don't like to send things back). Our waiter was GREAT!
Thank you!
V Hall
Everyone was very attentIve and the food was good but on the sweet side for my taste. We ate the 12 course meal, which took too long. I think we were all ready to leave by the 8th or 9th course.

As always...consistent good food with service that can be sometimes irregular, comes through in the end...yes, a true neighborhood gem...the periodic regional menus give the place a nice feel and things are never too loud
Service was excellent, very good food, friendly people. Thanks opentable for pointing out this gem!!! The only downside was the train whistle that was pretty constant.
Inside is not too loud, acoustics are good
You menu is an adventure. We will be back again and again.
Manhattan-esqe Five-Star Dining in Chicago, professional staff, was seated exactly at my reserved time, but could not hear my guests due to noise levels.
Fast, efficient service. Not necessarily a "special occasion"-type restaurant, but if I lived up in Santa Ynez, I'd come here every week.
I've been to Teatro many times over the past 5 years and the food has always been excellent, the service right on for the restarant and never a disappointment. The decor however is very dated.
They have improved service and tightened up the ship here. Time to expand wine offerings by the glass and to add a seasonal short menu.
The scallops and the soft eggs w/lobster were awesome. A bit too loud.
It's been 3 years since I went for Sat brunch. The portion has increased substantially since. The cinnamon roll is big now as well as the eggs. Still decent value, though.
Food portions are incredible and eating family style is a good way to try new things although it was quite noisy.
A bit noisy but overall a very good experience. Seafood with pasta was outstanding.
Absolutely loved this restaurant, except for the ambiance. Second time going because the food is delicious. Great service.
The food was fine, but our server elevated the experience.
Loved the Lobster entrees - would  recommend them. Appetizer sampler recommended by the waiter was very good.
Amazing way with seafood. Try the Lasagnette pasta course and the shrimp with crabmeat salad. You'll certainly want to clean your plate.
We went for a girls night out and it was a decent spot for that. The fixed 3 course dinner menu was fantastic with very good options to choose from. The service, however, was slow and boorish.
Menu had lots of interesting choices. Spinach salad and amberjack fish special were awesome. Celebration across restaurant at sunset was fun, but the ambiance could use some help!
Becco was great! The tables were a little close, but that was better than having less tables and waiting longer.

We had a great time on Valentine's Day. Hostess was pleasant and accomodating. We were seated a few minutes before our reserved time.
Food was just average, but the service was very good.

My wife and I dine at Maggiano's several times a year for date nights and special occasions. Each visit is a memorable experience. Our favorite Italian spot in Houston. However, the place can get very loud at times.
Food was pretty good but rich. Warm and cozy atmosphere. Also, it would be nice if they validated parking!

This was the slowest I had ever seen it...of course, the 2 feet of snow outside I am sure had nothing to do with it! Service was still great, food was even better! Biggest drawback is how loud it is inside.
Not too noisy but overall a very good experience. Seafood with pasta was outstanding.
This is a great low key place right in the heart of Hollywood. Food was priced fairly and the service and atmosphere were really great. Will be back
I didn't feel that the overpriced wine list was respectable nor was the desert list braod enough. The decor was wonderful though.

Not too crowded.
Our table was far from all high-traffic service aisles and we were never interrupted by waiters or guests.
Very relaxing!
Excellent food but bad service. Feed Me Justin is excellent!! Will definitely be back
Excellent choices for Sunday brunch. Staff is always friendly and polite. It can get noisy unfortunately.
Seven of us dined there and it was lovely, but very loud. We had a great time, enjoyed the food and the friendship. The fish and lamb were perfectly done.

Greate experience. Reception by manager was quite welcoming. A little too noisy in the dining area. The food was great as usual and the service just as good. One of the greatest things about Sovana Bistro is consistency.
The paella was excellent! Great wine list - good variety. The decor could be updated.
The adult service was very good.
Great food, service and atmosphere, other than the loud dining room. Scallop dish was outstanding as was the apple dessert and caesar salad. We were first timers that will be back with friends.
Consistently good and reasonably priced. Never visit SF without dining here and regularly recommend it to friends. However, it was hard to hear my friends while I was dining here.

The food was very good and the ambiance was on point, but the waiter was awful. The waiter had a sarcastic attitude & his service was horrible. The busboys were very good & all of the tip should have gone to them.

Excellent in all aspects except the food was overcooked. I would highly recommend to friends and family.
The ambiance is romantic. The service is fun and professional.
Good service and great for a big group.
TWO ITEMS: 1. The tables are spaced well. It is easy to walk between them.

Great value for delicious, filling lobster.
Good for family style eating.
service was good.
We go to a lot of tasting menus in the city. This one was great but not our favorite.
I used to like I Trulli and was coming there on regular basis, but this time it was completely different,I ordered their tasting meny and it was great.
our second time at Zocco - really enjoyed the food, wine, and riverwalk view despite the lacking service.

The food was great.
Good and attentive service and the food was good. I liked it but fear my husband won't want to go back!
Not too thrilled walking thru the kitchen area to come, leave or use the rest room. Table was in a nice. quiet corner and made for a romantic dinner.

Great Ambiance.
Great time, slow service, but the food was good, price was right! I`d go back again!

Right On time seating our party 
with reservations made 2 weeks before.

our 4th time to the restaurant - the ambiance is poor, but it is a must visit for us when we're in NY.

Catching up with an old friend, we came after the theater crowd left, drank wine, ate well, service was a bit slow, stayed on for hours. Lovely rooms, great Roman food.

food has been better and the service was ridiculously good for such a nice restaurant!
Been to this restaurant many times and our food this time around was way above mediocre.

This is one of our favoriter Jackson resurants.
AAAAAA++++++.

Thank you.
We had easter brunch... it was really a good buffet.
Great little place. Delicious food, good service, quite lively in the evening. A little noisy though

The most mouth-watering mushroom ravioli Special the nite we went. Should be added to the Menu!

Great Cosmopolitans.

With only 13 tables its makes for a tight cozy fit that it isnt a distraction sitting close to anyone. Food has always been great.

Once again our group had an excellent evening in spite of the noise.
attentive and friendly staff.
place to visit and enjoy real Italian food at its best.

Food is good. The service was one step ahead the whole meal. Live music is good.
I'll come back.

Food is good. Although the service is a little slow.
I'll come back.

the service was very slow . but the food was great . the pasta was cooked well . asked for one type of pasta and got another .

the Chef were very nice about menu special requests.

great food even though it was a little pricey for what you are getting.

Food just delicious. Probably will return.

Great atmosphere.

Ugly decor but great food and great service.

everything was great except for the service/we will be going their again

Have been here several times and the food is always great!!!! I have not had a large party in their private rooms but I would surly not choose L'Andana to host a party. Great find that is not in the city.

Our meal was very good. I am salavating over the marinated octopus. Yum. The only downside is that the dessert menu didn't really entice me, but overall very good experience with a great ambiance.
Very noisy atmosphere; varied and reasonably-priced menu and outstanding service.
With only 13 tables its makes for a tight cozy fit and the noise is a distraction sitting close to anyone. Food has always been great.
Best service! Great food! Terrible noise level Wonderful experience.
i have been to centro before and enjoyed it. typically solid. service was good without problem. . will try restaurant again, nonetheless.

One of the better Italian restaurants on the Peninsula. Service was a little spotty but very friendly. Very good wine selection.

food was great.

the main course are outstanding. the price was much higher then we expected, and is in the range of 40-50$ per person or a bit higher for 3 course diner. The ambiance was perfect

limited menus-food well prepared and quite nice classical music piped through the dining room
Great staff that is knowledgeable.
Food was okay. Extremely good place to go for lunch, servers are very attentive!

Great ambience but very average at best food. The best thing on the menu is the mac n cheese...delisshhhh!

Awesome place, one of my favorites in Houston. The decor matches the location perfectly. I felt atmosphere was great. Maybe I'm just nostalgic, but I personally enjoy the original location in the village over the new one on Washington Ave.

Food was tasty, presentation very well done. I would eat here again.

Fantastic experience. Will return many times. The noise is very disruptive though.

we will be going their again

the ambiance complemented the good comments about food & service. I had no headache when I left.

We had a great time and a very very good meal.
