It was for the very young crowd.Definitely recommend if you want to have a conversation.It was a very small place. Made a good choice for my 25th wedding anniversary.
The food was very good and the service was exceptional, but it seemed a bit overpriced to me compared to some of the other upscale pizza places.

I have always enjoyed my experiences at the Grand Cafe, no matte if I have duck, chicken or steak. It is a well-planned menu, and yet offers surprises at the same time. So I enjoyed my experience except that the whole place was incredibly loud.

i reserved a dinner for our anniversary and it was really as i targetted. my wife found it very romantic. we enjoyed the great food and the service. perfect place for romantic dinners. But the problems were that the place had bad light.  Just to bright.

We enjoyed our experience at Cero and have eaten there when the hotel was a St Regis. The food was delicious and cooked to our liking with all requests met, but the sound level was irritating. We would definitely go back.
The food and service were great.
Not overpriced for the prompt service and friendly service they offer
It was good--though the food could not have been better for the price being paid. I am looking for food items that are flavorful.
Good food, great wine list. I know turn over is king but it deters me from bringing more than just one other person.
It was a little loud for a romantic dinner but it had amazing service and wonderful food.
Great food, horrible atmosphere, awesome service. Love, love, love it!
Simple, authentic menu. Service could have been better. A reliable, comfort food stand-by!

Really loved it - the food was amazing and the service as attentive but not intrusive. Really great. Everyone should write down all the Top Chef Masters' names and go find their restaurants. Only thing that could have improved was the lighting.
Perfect night, wonderful service, despite a nosy dining area and unique menu. The food was excellent.
great for those who like American-Red-Check-Tablecloth-Italian food; good selection of quality beers on tap; reasonably priced. great atmosphere.
outdated decor, but really wonderful
Cool place and not expensive...
Food is consistently well prepared and delicious. Loud fun atmosphere but staff can be rude at times.
As #21 on the Washingtonian best restaurants, I was impressed, especially by the efficient service.
Excellent place to visit and enjoy real Italian food at its best, if you don't mind a little noise.
Great kid's menu. Many items to choose from or some 1/2 size items for children as well.
Food is consistently well prepared and delicious. Atmosphere is a bit boring.
Great wine list, I would stick to cheese, wine and maybe a few appetizers. Pizza was fair. The ambiance was good and made me feel like I was eating at home.

This was the slowest I had ever seen it...of course, the 2 feet of snow outside I am sure had nothing to do with it! It was nice and quiet and I didn't have to scream across the table. Service was still great, food was even better!
Danny Meyer for the win, as usual. Service is impeccable. Only drawback is the noise.
We had a great meal and a great time, minus inattentive waiter. We will return.
out of four meals, three would reccommend theirs to a friend or order again. great outdoor atmosphere and noise levels!
Everything came together delightfully at Rendezvous - great table - slow, unresponsive service - excellent food...absolutely a treat and a place we will return often!
Great food...bad service...terrific cocktails...fairly priced...almost a perfect restaurant!!!
Terrible service, but delicious cuisine, wonderful ambiance-it has it all!
The food were great.
Very good food and service, but way too noisy.
Very feel-good place to dine and the food is fabulous. I like that you keep the menu changing. The only problem was that our waiter never asked if we needed water.
Great ambience, good sound level but very average at best food. The best thing on the menu is the mac n cheese...delisshhhh!
Loud fun atmosphere.
We enjoyed our experience at Rocca very much, though it was hard to have a conversation because of the noise level. Everything else - food, service - was great.
The food was wonderful.  I will go back there.

Consistently good and reasonably priced. Never visit SF without dining here and regularly recommend it to friends. It was also the right volume in terms of sound so you could enjoy your meal in peace.
okay food, fantastic server was on point, filled coffee often during our breakfast meal...in general did not leave us needing a thing after taking our order
Always enjoy going to Eddie Merlot's. If not so pricey, would go more often. The service could be better though.
The food was even better than I had expected considering the hype for the restaurant. However, very slow service and it wasn't very busy. Probably why it was so easy to get a table.
Excellent appetizers, salads and desserts. Entrees marginal. Nice and quiet.
Pretty good neighborhood restaurant. The appetizer and salad were excellent. However my entree was way too salty and my wife's way too bland. Would definitely try it again though.
The food was great as usual, but it came so quickly. It felt like we were rushed. Despite this, I enjoyed the atmosphere during a brief visit.

Greate experience. Reception by manager was quite welcoming. The food was great as usual and the service just as good. One of the greatest things about Sovana Bistro is consistency.  But the only bad thing is that the place is just to loud, they fix that and it is prefect place all around.
Very pleasant surroundings complemented by the low volume of noise
Service was very good. 1 meal didn't come until the other diners were almost done (my daughter-the birthday girl), and the server went out of her way to make up for it. Very accommodating.
Pricey but the food was delicious. My friend and I ordered the shrimp scampi and it was tasty- lots of hints of garlic.
The food was good, but what I would come back for is the extremely attentive service; what I don't like is the wildly awkward ambiance. A great experience all-in-all.
Awesome meal and staff. Attention to detail fantastic. The only off putting thing was the place had a bad vibe.

Very good food at very reasonable prices. If you can't get in for dinner, at least visit for lunch during a visit to the Big Easy. My only complaint is that it is usually too loud if you sit anywhere near the bar.
Delightful atmosphere. Great place to relax before or after a tour of the CIA. Great breads. Small portion sizes.
food was good
Food was ok. Service was awesome. Staff was timely and seemed interested.
Neighborhood oldie but goodie. My tummy is always happy when it leaves. Cozy place but a bit too loud. Try the mac and cheese with the ham...you'll be glad you did.
Very pleasant evening. The restaurant was crowded so basically lots of loud talking and noise. Mussels delicious as was the pear salad and tuna caparcio.
We took relatives to Laurus to celebrate a birthday and had a very pleasant experience. Food was very good and there wasn't too much noise. I plan to return with a group of seniors this month.
Lack of consistency to be inventive on food. Good ambience.
The desserts for Restaurant Week were fabulous, the starters were good, the main course were good, but not exceptional. However, forget all that, go for the desserts!
We had to wait 30 minutes for our table, but the service was amazing and the restaurant was so relaxing.
Great food - great service. A little noisy. Love the menu.
Great beer seletion and great take on some comfort foods.
The service were truly outstanding. I am so glad I don't live upstairs.
LIVE MUSIC WAS perfect volume and we could still talk
the service great! Make a reservation or you will have quite a wait.
It was pretty good, and we had no wait with reservations.

Cafe Fiore is consistantly been one of the best restaurants in all of Ventura. Food is great, service is fantastic and friendly. Only bad thing was the ambiance because it was so dark in there. Other than that, you won't be disappointed.
Our dinner was fantastic. Overall, awesome & romantic dinner. Waitress was a little
Besides the horrible ambiance, the service was incredible and the food was very good.
The food and the service were at the level that I was expecting for a restaurant that is owned by a renowned chef.
We had a great time and a very very good meal, but the service was quite poor.
A good, solid all-around fish house. The kids menu is quite complete and the kids plates come with fresh fruit and fresh vegetables. Great service
Lovely restaurant. Great service. Tiny bitesize burger was $15.
Portions are generous and fairly priced.
This is one of the best in St Helena. The food and service are ALWAYS top notch although the music was too loud and it was too dark.

This place was great. Good Service. Good Food, Good Wine. I'm Italian and this food rocks. I am also a amateur cook and think the portions were spot on. Atmosphere can be loud and unfriendly at times.
the gluten free menu is what brings me here...a nice neighborhood Italian restaurant with pleasant service. was too loud on this occasion though!
food & wine menu are very unlimited. they had lobster bisque (which is on menu). Portions are huge. tables are very close together. prices are affordable.

fantastic spot in every way!! so very happy with the the whole experience, food, staff, atmosphere.... all suberb!!! great service, great place, great food!!!The only bad thing is the place was too loud, was hard to hear partner speak.
i love piola very good restaurant, just a bit loud.
what a perfect spot for a romantic dinner; lousy service but wonderful food.
One of the best meals I have ever had even though it was terribly noisy with construction going on nearby.

Our experience at Avalon was wonderful. The set menu for Valentine's day offered enough choices and the antipasto was amazing. The ambiance was difficult to ignore because it was disruptive, but the staff were excellent.
One of the better Italian restaurants on the Peninsula. Service was spotty though and the staff was inattentive. Very good wine selection.
Minute-sized portions and an extraordinarily quick and efficient kitchen made for a better-than-ideal experience.
service was great. food was terrific. noise level was one of the highest
Food was good, but the noise level was too high for us. Modern and great looking decor.
The customer service was excellent, but the views are disappointing. The prices are very reasonable.
The food was good.
Great French restaurant. Wonderful people working here, and the food is wonderful. Not loud, but it could be more modern, too. I would highly reccommend this restaurant.
out of four meals, three would reccommend theirs to a friend or order again. great outdoor atmosphere!
A good, solid all-around fish house. The kids menu is quite complete and the kids plates come with fresh fruit and fresh vegetables. Very kid friendly music which was a nice touch.
I was looking forward to taste galettes, and they totally fulfilled my expectations.
We enjoyed our experience at Rocca very much, though it was hard to have a conversation because of the noise level. Everything else - food, was great.
This is some of the best Italian food I've ever had. It even impressed our friends from Italy. Magnifico! We weren't impressed with the ambience however.
When this was La Bufala it was much better. The food has gotten better though. Pizza was good.
the music was perfect this time - nice and jazzy, perfect for a French bistro on a Sunday morning - they need to always stay away from the techno pop
absolutely loved it good food good people, but very loud
I bring my girlfriend to the Sole Proprietor for some quality food and bonding time but it was hard to talk over the noise. We are always treated very well and never have to worry about the quality.
appetizers were served to us (party of 2) 5 mins apart. both entrees were nice and hot. lamb was good and i had been consulted in advance as to how i wanted it. all courses were tasty.
This resturant is a delight. Very pretty and food is great. This was my first visit and I am definitely going back. The service was good, very attentive and accomodating. The noise was a bit loud

Thank you - we enjoyed the evening. As noted above, service was excellent, as was food. Noise level made it
difficult to converse, and ambiance was bad, but still enjoyed it.
THE FOOD WAS ABOVE PAR. MY FISHERMAN'S PLATTER LOOKED LIKE MOUND OF OF BREADING AND WAS VERY DELICIOUS. THE TASTE WAS AWESOME. THE FLOUNDER THAT MY SON ORDERED WAS LITERALLY DROWNED IN BUTTER.

Portabello mushroom raviolis were delicious. Husband's cheesecake with fresh berries wonderful. Focaccia bread with 3 dipping sauces was the perfect way to begin the meal. Yummy yummy! The ambiance isn't good though.
I went there with my wife for restaurant week. The food was above average and well seasoned.
We sat outside and the food was great.
Very good value.
the food was awesome and the service was outstanding. great place to dine. best time is during happy hour get half price on raw bar. recommend this highly. however do not reccommend the sushi there.
Well presented tasty food. We saw all age groups. Although we didn't have the "small portion" menu it appears many others did. We liked the pre-fix options as well.
Our waitress automatically added a 20% plus tip for a party of 5. unpresumptious and cool service.
A bit noisy but overall a very good experience.
wonderful food, good service. Definitely worth a return visit.
Delicious, inexpensive, doting, vibrant. Service was slow, but overall loved it

Waiter was very rude but was replaced after complaining to the manager who was extremely very nice and curteous to me and wife. The noise level was acceptable. We felt we could speak freely without nearby tables hearing.

The food was wonderful, and the service was great. We couldn't ask for a better place to go, except that it had a bad ambiance. Just looking for some place different yet reasonable, and this restaurant fit the bill!! Thank you.
A gem. Note, it can get very loud on weekends.
i reserved a dinner for our anniversary and it was really as i targetted. we enjoyed the great food and the service.
Bouchon at the Venetian was a great time out in Vegas. Nice service and atmosphere. Will definitely check out more of Keller's spots in California after a successful dinner in Vegas.
The place was fine and well lit. Will return and introduce to more people.

Great brunch menu, would have expected a bit more special planning for Easter sunday, but the food was excellent. They also had lovely Easter decorations and flowers. Gravitas is always a great choice!
I liked that we didn't have to wait.
This was my first time dining at Pace and the overall experience was wonderful although it is too loud. We still had a very romantic evening and the food was incredible! We will be back.... a lot!

Very nice, friendly, comfortable Italian restaurant in a rennovated adobe home. Food was excellent; waiter seemed a little inexperienced, but was very attentive. Nice, lovely music in the dining room, casual place. Would return.
Go there for the food.
It was great! Great food. Great service. Had a wonderful time, except not being able to converse due to the noise.
A good, solid all-around fish house. The kids menu is quite complete and the kids plates come with fresh fruit and fresh vegetables. Too bad the other kids in the restaurant were screaming.
Perfectly good NY experience. acceptable service.
Everything was fantastic and then music started and it got better. but I gave ambiance, overall,  a not so hot rating....
One our favorite spots in D.C. The food is fresh and delicious, the service is friendly and the atomsphere is vibrant. Tables are a bit close, though the noise level is good.
A very expensive meal with great food. Our food, quite frankly, amazing. Ambiance is great, as is the service.
We had a very nice evening. The service was terrific, the food was not delish, but very reasonably priced.
The view is unbelievable of the las vegas strip. We celebrated a birthday and they brought a plate decorated with happy Birthday in choc. and some choc. mousse.
Well-rounded menu, with an excellent wine list. The salumi was outstanding, the butternut squash tortelloni was delicious, and the Panna Cotta Limone was to die for!!  Too bad the place was so loud!
food was terrific. noise level was one of the highest

Buca di Beppo has established a simple concept -- a ton of food for a fair price. Bonus: the food is delicious, if a bit heavy. Try the Scalopine. My only complaint would be that it was too loud inside.
Very impressed. Had a blast. Service and food were top notch, although it was a little noisy. Can't wait to go back!
The customer service was excellent. The views are wonderful. The prices are very reasonable.
This is our favorite French Restaurant in the Denver area. The food is fantastic, the ambiance isn't great, but the service is top-knotch. Try it - you won't be disappointed!
Great restaurant!! Service and food was exceptional, however it was too loud. Even was a celebrity.
It wasn't too loud or quiet inside, would definitely recommend for a romantic evening. food is good but expensive.
It was a very pleasant experience. We enjoyed the food, the service and the wine list is great - the prices a bit high. I will definitely go back.
A gem. Note, it can get very loud on weekends.

Wonderful spot, great comfort food. All the breads are delicious, and the pig in a poke is a favorite. Stumptown coffee, and glazed donuts to boot! Will definitely return despite the terribly slow waiter..
2 of the best things I've ever eaten: Buttermilk Biscuit and the Cheddar Jalepeno Grits. Double Yum. Ambiance was poor however.
This was my first experience with the brunch and it was fantastic! The food and the service were exceptional, but the atmosphere was lacking.
This is my favorite restaurant in Orange County even though it's much too loud.
An absolute treat! Although the service is poor, the food is fantastic, and the ambience makes you forget you're in Cleveland.

food was quite good. off the beaten track and pretty good value
waiter knew how to decant wine and didn't dump old wine (brought in) with sediment into decanter.
The menu was amazing, the service was lacking and the chef was wonderful!!
The service was great and I was impressed with the food. Try one of Mr. Batali's other restaurants, like Otto, which was just as good.
Love everything about The Library Bistro! Bad service, but wonderful food, and the best Bloody Marys! Plus they gave all Moms a lovely tulip (from the Market I am presuming) which was a nice touch.
The Pasta Trio was great as was the wine selection. The tables are so close together you can hear the table next to you breathing. Other than the snug quarters, great! We will go back!
A welcome addition to the Heights dining scene. I found the menu to be a bit restricted but the taste of the food is wonderful I would have liked more choices or maybe some side options.

we love the restaurant and most everything about it.
excellent food and ambience...good wait staff is the only thing lacking.
Great AUTHENTIC Italian food. Thier pastas are great. Only negative is how dark it is.
Great food as always. Service was on the slow side (European style), but that was great as my group was chatting and in no rush.
We have been here many times. The food is always excellent and the source very good. The atmosphere is the one detriment.
Didn't seem too expensive for what you get, and it tasted wonderful. No mixed drinks. Both bottles of wine that we picked were not available or out of stock.
Price fixed lunch was great. Appetizer took 45 minutes to arrive but worth it. Pasta entree was tasty.

This was my first visit to L'Andana. The food and service were great.
The decor was lovely. My only complaint was the music . It was too low, and not
appropriate. It was too much like a disco club.
Great experience where the food, service and atmosphere all made for a romantic dinner! It was so loud when the dining room got full though!
Upscale, sophisticated Italian. Traditional Italian dishes done.
a great menu!
Outstanding food and service - 3rd trip to this restaurant. The tables are crowded which makes it seem very loud.
Went for brunch on Sunday and it was amazing. The food was delish, not too expensive and a bottomless Mimosa for $9 never hurt! It was a bit too loud though
Quality of Food was great for the price of the meal.
They are interested in training staff right now and providing quality service. Sushi still good though.
The food and the service were at the level that I was expecting for a restaurant that is owned by a renowned chef. Noisy though
Food is good. Although the service is a little slow. I'll come back.
Pleasant, beautifully decorated place for lunch. service can be good or slow especially for late lunch.
Friendly staff. Would definitely return.
Great brunch menu, would have expected a bit more special planning for Easter sunday,  Gravitas is always a great choice!
Menu was interesting--pizzas not the usual fare. Staff friendly and efficient. Fabulous locale if you're going to a ballgame despite the poor view and lack of ambiance.
excellent food in an energetic environment. noise level was perfect for easy conversation.
ok for a pre-theater meal but nothing special. Service was a good experience.
Great little place. Delicious food, it is quite lively in the evening, but the service was poor.
The best baked stuffed Lobster ever. Cooked to perfection. I wish the restaurant was a bit quieter, though.
Food and service was fabulous!! There were a couple bigger tables but it didn't get too loud. Would have liked it to be a little more intimate to match the decor.
Appetizers were as flavorful as the entrees. Dining area a little too noisy for normal conversation. Wine recommendation was well given. Ambiance was romantic and tasteful.
Very nice, friendly, Italian restaurant. Food was excellent; waiter seemed a little inexperienced, but was very attentive. Would return.
Menu sounds worse than it is! Ribs were great,
Amazing way with seafood. Try the Lasagnette pasta course and the shrimp with crabmeat salad. It was quite noisy but You'll certainly want to clean your plate.
Loved it once again. Ordered a salad special with pomegranate seeds.
Pretty pricey- even for an expense account. Beautiful dining room.
Been here before, so I was really looking forward to my second visit, fortunately it was very good. The desert was fabulous. The rest was as well..
Makes going to the opera easy! Food is adequate - nothing special. Appetizers are literally (one) bite-sized. The waitress was empathetic to our complaints though.
We went on a very hectic night...but were seated right at our reservation time.
Our waiters were really great, fun, and timely.... Tues., 3/9, 1:30.
The only thing I really don't like is to be forced to tip with the 20% that is included in the check!I prefer to put it by myself

My wife and I dine at Maggiano's several times a year for date nights and special occasions. Each visit is a memorable experience. Our last trip there was a little disappointing service wise but it is still our favorite Italian spot in Houston.

This is one of our favoriter Jackson resurants. but way too noisy 
AAAAAA++++++.
Thank you.
Went for Mother's Day Brunch. The place was cute inside. Nice French Bistro decor.
Good food, it was not very crowded.
It was great. Kind of pricey but worth it!
phenomenal!! I would go again....and again...and again, even though the food lacked seasoning.
Absolutely the best service in Atlantic City with outstanding cuisine and wine list, but it was very loud.
Food was great and service was special. Noise wasn't great though. We'll be back.
Very nice ambiance and very good service. City Table *did* introduce me to a fine Pinot Noir, however -- the 2008 Hob Nob. Loved it!
Food was tasty and the food presentation was great. Taste is important to me. Service was very good, very attentive
Best food in Sonoma County! However, the service can be hit or miss.
Lovely in every way. Great ambiance but my halibut came out pretty cold though-my only gripe.
Very impressed. Had a blast. Service and food were top notch but please do something about the ambiance.
Everything was so nice but the drink prices are ridiculously high. Service definitely makes up for it though.
A real Old-Time NYC restaurant inside Grand Central terminal that has a great historical vibe to it. The concrete makes it loud, but the food is good. Pricey for the meal though.
We just returned from Italy and this food is just like the incredible meals we had in Rome and Florence. Everything is flavorful and cooked to perfection. The only downside was how loud it was.
Food was great - will definately return! The ambiance was nice as well.

David Burke seems to get better and better. Short rib "pot pie" a Sunday special is wonderful. Wines are chosen carefully, reasonably priced and always enjoyable. Highly recommended, but the noise and vibe is a little too much for a casual night out.
The food and service far exceeded my expectations. A good place to sit down and enjoy good food and friends, but a bad option if you are trying to hold a conversation
Everything was great, but the service. At least it was quiet! One of our Top Twenty in San Diego
Lovely restaurant. Great service. Only food was average. Tiny bitesize burger was $15. I did enjoy the atmopshere.

I think due to the neighborhood traffic this resto gets alot of play.
The staff is very friendly & efficient
Prices are a tad high
Nice place....tables were separated enough to create a great feel for a "romantic" Valentines' dinner.
Great food, great atmosphere, excellent value, but rude waiters.
Been here several times. Always a winner! But always too loud!!
Consistently great food & service at reasonable prices--Monday & Tuesday wine special-$10 per bottle is a favorite-- beware the noise though.
The food and service far exceeded my expectations. A convenient place to sit down and enjoy good food and friends even though the it is very dimly lit.
I enjoyed Gilmore's very much would recomend it to all my friends as long as they don't mind the noise.
I made reservation for wrong night but they honored it when I came the next day. (I forgot to change the date and I made it for the day I was sending it in instead of the next day.)
The Parma Pizza, Cannoli, and Nutella tart were outstanding. Service did not live up to the food. We were celebrating an occasion and found it to be a wonderful experience aside from the waiter.
This is our favorite French Restaurant in the Denver area. But the food lately has been bad, the ambiance is great, and the service is top-knotch. Try it - you won't be disappointed!
The food was expensive but great - $ for $ it's worth it. Our waiter was wonderful and the restaurant was very nice.
Cafe Gibraltar has a fabulous selection on its menu, the food is made with the freshest ingredients, and the seasoning is excellent! The only drawback is how loud it is.
I was not expecting mardi gras menu but the entire menu was mardi gras. Good tasting food.
We were there on a Sunday night and it wasn't busy.  we'll be back on a Sunday night : ).

We had a terrific evening at La Tavola--would highly recommend & would happily return here when in Baltimore. Zagat review was right on target! Only downside is that the ambiance left something to be desired.
A decent meal in the French Quarter. The signature dish-- the Red Fish-- is quite overpriced at nearly $33 but the band was amazing.
The food was great as usual, but it came so quickly. It felt like we were rushed but it was nice and quiet.
LOVE Otto!! Everyone could not say enough about how delicious the food and wine was, but it's just very loud inside.
The wine list is delicious, and the tapas style menu choices are great. I'd rather not go down the street to Cork.
Went to TH for an anniversary dinner and really enjoyed it. The staff was wonderful, the food great, and ambiance was lively, though it was pretty loud.
wine selection was great and the food is up to par given prices and expectations
The Food and meal were excellent. The only thing lacking was the view of the water show, which we made a special request for and didn't receive.
Excellent ambience,Food, Service could be faster, great wine list and resonably priced!
The food was great,its very relaxing. It did take a while to get food. I would like to have had the bread much sooner. It was overall good.
Chapeau is a gem....with bad ambience. The food was delicious, the service personal (without being officious)and helpful. I will return.

Perfect pre-theater dinner -- more imaginative than its competitors and better wine list. My only complaint is the service. The waiter had no idea how to tell the wines apart or even how to open a bottle. I had to help him with the corkscrew.
Despite the very hectic atmosphere as it was Valentine's Day, the food was great
Great food -- surprisingly nice ambiance and decor, considering it is below ground level. The service could be better though.
I've been to this restaurant, maybe 20 times. This was the first time I was a little disappointed. I like it well enough that I'm willing to give it another chance. (Everybody has their off days)
Advertise as having nice sounds. It's true!
Food and service was fabulous!! Was a little loud with a couple bigger tables. I liked that it was a little more intimate to match the decor.

I have always enjoyed my experiences at the Grand Cafe, no matte if I have duck, chicken or steak. It is a well-planned menu, and yet offers surprises at the same time. So I enjoyed my experience. The noise level is good.
Truly amazing. Went in with high expectations and they were met as a result of the beautiful condition of the dining room and the restaurant as a whole.
Staff was eager to help and tend to our needs.

The bar crowd was so quiet we could easily hear ourselves speaking in the back of the dining room.
Our waiter was excellent and friendly.
The food was satisfactory but not up to New Orlean's best.
Always dependably good service.
Oysters, fried clams terrific, special recognition for outstanding service from Thomas. The only complaint is that the music they play is too loud and doesn't fit.
Keeps getting better and better. Great location for pre-theater dining. Only reservation: wine list too heavily skewed to very expensive offerings.
Lovely evening - good service and wonderful food. Perfect for fresh fish fans. The noise was perfect and not too loud
Service was very attentive!
friendly and easy going staff. not what I was expecting for newbury, but pleasantly surprised.
Always a winner...great neighborhood place to greet friends
Good brunch deal and food is delicious for the price. Friendly service. Patio area is nice but a little rough around the edges, ie there was an old sconce behind my head that I hit a few times.
Great food. Fancy pants.
Great food. A little noisy. Love the menu.
Terrible service but the food was worth the wait.
They offer wines by the glass for several of their wines, but offer a limited variety of reds. For example, they had no red zinfandel's by the glass. Great tasting entrees.
We thoroughly enjoyed the dinner. Our server, Josh, was extremely proficient and very attentive. The dining room was a bit loud though. Thank you very much.
3rd time there, very good each time, but very loud.
Outstanding. The caliber of the singing was incredible. I don't know what I was expecting from singing waiters and waitresses but I was blown away. Great evening.The noise was a bit much
Service was excellent. Our waiter was very nice while serving us. Food was ok but not great.

I order a pasta with roasted chicken and was told that the chicken included was "substantial". It was true- very pleased I paid 15 dollars for pasta with a ton of chicken and some black olives and a bit of cauliflower.
it was very good except for the ambiance, and the waiter Mo was fantastic.....
Didn't take long for our food and the food was good. I liked it but fear my husband won't want to go back!
A bit noisy. Seafood with pasta was outstanding.

food was terrific. lots of choices on menu that might be considered to be on the lighter side.
best part of the meal was the presentation.
pricey

Lunch was very good and an exceptional value. Had the 3 course prix fixe for $25. Asparagus soup, chicken and a pistachio eclair. All excellent although the eclair was a bit too sweet. The food was a bit ruined because the waiter was inattentive and took awhile to bring drinks.

Truly belongs in the "neighborhood gem" category, especially with such great prices on impeccably served food. Hard to beat in these difficult times for restaurants and restaurant goers! Only downside is the noise around the building.
Portions were very generous and all the food was very tasty. Place is way too loud though.
I LOVE THIS RESTAURANT. IT'S BEEN MY FAVORITE EVER SINCE THEY OPENED. ALWAYS CONSISTENT AND THERE'S ALWAYS A CELEBRITY TO SEE. SLOW WAITERS THOUGH

The food and service was very good, and the decor was beautiful. My wife and I enjoyed a very nice dinner she had the Ahi Tuna and truelly enjoyed it, and my dish was very good also, but I will try something different next time.
Very good seafood with an impressive list of fresh-caught specials. Loud,dark. A little pricey, but very good quality and variety.
amazing - everything was perfect other than how loud it was

Thank you - we enjoyed the evening. As noted above, service was excellent, as was food. Noise level made it
difficult to converse, but still enjoyed it.
I thought the meals were a good price for the amout of the portion.
This place has very fresh seafood! You dine here for the atmosphere! To relive history of earlier centuries! =) Nice little joint especially if you are touring Boston, Mass! Service was terrible.

Food was pretty good but rich. 
Also, it would be nice if they validated parking!
OVERALL ENJOYED THE EXPERIENCE AND WAS HAPPY TO SEE THIS RESTURANT ON THE LIST. THE AMBIANCE WAS THE ONLY NEGATIVE THING ABOUT THE EXPERIENCE.

Interesting menu, a lot of great items.. flatbread good. Ambiance - a little sterile
I really enjoyed the food.
While the ambience was pleasant and the service, for the most part, attentive, the food was, on the whole, fairly delicious.
Great setting and crowd. Food and service were very enjoyable. Not worth the high prices.
great for those who like American-Red-Check-Tablecloth-Italian food; good selection of quality beers on tap; reasonably priced

Pretty good neighborhood restaurant. Would definitely try it again though.

One of our favorites. Food is delicious and imaginative. Best gnocchi I've ever had.
Service is very friendly, but the place was so loud we could't hold a conversation.
Food was both enjoyable and memorable. Given the prices, I want to be wowed, and I was! Cozy atmosphere. Don't sit in the front room because the bar area gets very loud. Will go back.
The service was nice.
Service was good.
Too noisy. Had to shout across the table. Impressed by big portions and excellent, attentive service.
The food presentation was great. Taste is more important to me. Service was very good, very attenative

The food was fab. had a GREAT bottle of Pinot (Belle & Glos). Wait staff was friendly and attentive. Could be the best restauirant in Hyde Park. Would definitely go back next time we're down there. Music and lighting were a bit harsh.

This was a very special dining experience. The waiter was attentive and knowledgeable, the food exquisite, and the entire evening just wonderful. We can't wait to go back. The only disappointment was how loud the place was, it made it difficult to experience the meal.
one of the best meals of our lives, but the ambiance was bad.
Great food....drinks were a little light on quantity..
Great service. Carrot soup was too salty. Risotto was excellent.
Celebration across restauratn at sunset was fun!
Food is consistently well prepared and delicious. Loud fun atmosphere, but terrible service.

we love the restaurant and everything about it.
excellent food and ambience...waiters who are great and an up atmosphere. I just wish it were quieter.
OVERALL ENJOYED THE EXPERIENCE AND WAS HAPPY TO SEE THIS RESTURANT ON THE LIST.

Friendly service and reasonable prices.

We had an awesome meal. I ate at Craftsteak and was somewhat disappointed and was somewhat reluctant to try Craft. However, this restuarant was almost everything you can ask for. As long as you're not too concerned with ambiance, we highly recommend it.
Love the high quality food, even if they have terrible service at a moderate price. it is a restaurant I return to again and again.
Overall enjoyed the food but the service was quick and efficient.

the food was awesome and the service was outstanding. great place to dine. best time is during happy hour get half price on raw bar. recommend this highly. however do not reccommend the sushi there. Way too loud.

Amazing meal -- special, especially for the price. Some items were good, others were poor. Worth the expense.

Loved it, we would definitely recommend it! The ambiance was not that good

One of the better restaurants on the Peninsula. Service was a little spotty but very friendly. Very good wine selection.

Interesting food, good service, great wine list, but somewhat overpriced

service needs some tweaking. Good drink deals and appetizer deals

Nice food. Be sure to sit away from the doorway leading from the bar and front door.

Very good for pre-theater lunch, very nice volume for casual conversation. Service was very good.

We sat outside and the food and quiet relaxing view were great.

the ambience was pleasant and the service, for the most part, attentive

great service. A little noisy. Love the menu.

very reasonable prices.

We had a great meal after the blizzard. Food and drinks were terrific, and the service with Tony was outstanding. We love this restaurant, and we're glad it's just a short walk away. The only thing we'd change is the deafening roar during dinner service.
service was excellent.
Our second time eating at Stella Sola and still our new favorite restaurant! I just wish the ambiance matched the quality of the food.
Everything was excellent except the waiter. They greeted and sat us promptly, served delicious complimentary appetizers. Food selections were all excellent.
Food was very good. Otherwise really good food; pizzas were better than salads.
A specoal birthday was held. Grandchildren and children came to celebrate their moms birthday. Everything went as planned and the restaurant couldn't be nicer, great environment for a party!
Excellent in all aspects except for the service, I would highly recommend to friends and family.
Service was slow but food was good.....oh and they got rid of their eggs benny and replaced them with some even better sauced thing....yummy.
We had a very enjoyable brunch, the wait staff was excellent and the food wonderful. The decor is simple and elegant and we had very lovely and leisurely brunch. Food wasn't very tasty
The music was great but the drinks were overpriced but the portions were worth the money The filet was perfectly cooked.
Our waiter was in tune with our time needs to make a performance at the Kennedy Center.
The food was great! Dewey was very attentive to our needs and made my first visit to Buca very enjoyable. I was too noisy for my taste though.
We had a very nice dinner and the food was good. We sat upstairs for the first time and that was a bad space. We will go back sometime and just enjoy the bar.
Great food and service. Will recommend it to others.

Portabello mushroom raviolis were delicious. Husband's cheesecake with fresh berries wonderful. Focaccia bread with 3 dipping sauces was the perfect way to begin the meal. Yummy yummy! The staff was rude though and need some training.
outdated decor, but really wonderful pasta dishes. Plus the music was quiet and relaxing.
Great location in beautiful hotel.
One of the best Filets I have ever enjoyed! Bernaise sauce was excellent as well. Too bad the ambiance isn't up to par.
For many years it was one of my favorites; however, the prices have doubled but the service is so good that I will be returning soon.
Food was quite good, good variety, but eggplant parm needs to be added to the menu. Staff was quick and friendly
Really delicious Italian food. Not necessarily a "special occasion"-type restaurant, but if I lived up in Santa Ynez, I'd come here every week.
Full room at Monday lunch......meal was portioned well... will be returning
Bill & his staff are to be commended on the service!

I was there for a business networking luncheon and everyone had a great time, despite the service. Our waiter wasn't very friendly and attentive. I'll definitely return with friends and hopefully another waiter.
We were big fans of Rocca's last Chef for several years. Our meal Friday night was amazing. We miss the old menu. Too bad.
Appetizers were more flavorful than the entrees. Dining area quiet enough for normal conversation. Wine recommendation was well given. Ambiance was romantic and tasteful.
One of the top places to dine in Las Vegas as long as you don't mind the noise. The food is excellent - the view is to die for
We were not disappointed. Hadn't been there for a while. The atmosphere is great and the 70s music was fun. The food was expensive, but tasty
Over all a pleasant experience, though the service was not up to par, waited to long for bread and ordering, food was good.
Food was awesome, great list of beer and wine, great dinning experience other than the noise level.
We had a very nice dinner and the food was good. We sat upstairs for the first time and that was a nice space. We will go back sometime and just enjoy the bar.
Great experience. We had the degustation menu with wine pairings. Everything was top-notch. Dining room could be updated.
You menu is an adventure and the server was charming. We will be back again and again even though the dining room is a bit gloomy.

Awesome place, one of my favorites in Houston. Maybe I'm just nostalgic, but I personally enjoy the original location in the village over the new one on Washington Ave. This one has a strange ambiance.

This place was great. Good Service. Good Food, Good Wine. I'm Italian and this food rocks. I am also a amateur cook and think the portions were spot on. But the place was super loud, really to much noise.
We had a terrific evening at La Tavola--would highly recommend & would happily return here when in Baltimore. Zagat review was right on target! but the noise was too much.
Service was outstanding! Food was good. Way too loud during happy hour.

We had a terrific time for our 39th Wedding Anniversary. The dining room was very busy so it was a little loud.Thanks a lot! If I had any surprise, it was that we were not comp-ed for our dessert as an Anniversary gift from you.
We had wonderful service, all staff was extremely friendly, our outside table's view was spectacular.
Always great. One of our favorites...The service is average at best though.
It was my first time at Cyrano's and I must say that I'm impressed!! The service is outstanding and the menu is impressive, but the noise is unpleasant. I'm still coming back soon!!
Great French restaurant. The food is wonderful. Not cheap, but it could be more expensive, too. I would highly reccomend this restaurant.
Food was fabulous,  service was lacking and understaffed, and the ambiance was fantastic. Will definitely recommend to friends and family.
Terrific food but a noisy atmosphere. Perfect before or after museum visit. Valet parking (expensive) but worth it on a raindy day.
Truly amazing. Went in with high expectations and they were met except my salad was not very tasty.

they sat us down, we asked for a wine list and 20 minutes later I went and got he bar tender who took care of us. he was a nice man and it was good to moderate sevice after that...and we loved the ambiance
Always enjoy going to Eddie Merlot's. If not so pricey, would go more often.
Food was good.
We had a lovely experience...very genteel service and good food, however it was quite noisy.
excellent food in an energetic environment. noise level was too high for easy conversation. Service was quick.

consistently great food and cocktails. the ONLY downside is that the wine list is a little pricey and they won't let you BYOB. otherwise an outstanding place with a great ambiance that never lets me down.
Filet mignon was very tasty. Later on I found from the chef that it was a center cut. It costed over $26.
we were looking for a quiet place to gather for dinner and convesation. Objective accomplished
$125.00 for a great meal that was not rushed through.

Everyone was very attentIve and the food was good but on the sweet side for my taste. We ate the 12 course meal, which took too long. I think we were all ready to leave by the 8th or 9th course. The tacky atmosphere didn't help.

Good service, would definitely go back.
Great pre-theatre spot in Grand Center with wonderful ambiance.

As always, great service, you are not rushed to finish meal.

Scott Contant has another hit on his hands. We loved the brunch menu. Everything we ordered in this stunning new restaurant was a winner. This is a definite new favourite! I did expect to see a better ambiance for a new restaurant though.
It lives up to the image presented on their website.
A quaint bistro off the usual circuit in Center City with a distinct, Mediterranean/Moroccan feel. Nice ambiance and good service.
The place is really nice.
Great food as usual.
Service was rushed. Pasta tasted wonderful and straight out of a five star restaurant - just what I expected from an Italian restaurant of this caliber. Veal chop was tasty, but overpriced.
excellent service very attentive; great selection of french bisto type items. butter lettuce salad outstanding!! Can't wait to return...only complaint is the high noise level inside.
Always enjoy going to Eddie Merlot's. If not so pricey and food was better than mediocre, would go more often.
Some of the best service in the Twin Cities. This small Bistro has a wonderful winelist, and great entrees although the interior could be updated.
Love the buzz and the food at Marcella's. We're budget-minded but find this a great place to spend a little more than our usual (low) allowance to treat ourselves to a great dining experience.
My family and friends love sitting at the bar

Standard, tasty Italian dishes; pretty special. The restaurant wad almost completely empty at 6:30 on a Friday evening. Lots of tables in several rooms made it feel tight.

The service left nothing to be desired. therefore our experience was very pleasant.
prices were very reasonable, and the staff was friendly and attentive. The location is convenient, especially if you are staying at The Pfister.
Service was very good and well-paced eventhough the restauranct was not very busy. It seemed that the waiter was engaged and just wanted to go help.

nice dinner
the food was awesome. great place to dine. best time is during happy hour get half price on raw bar. recommend this highly. however do not reccommend the sushi there.

The service and ambience was excelelnt, portion sizes were could not have been better.

Mixed grill was very good, stuff trout tasted fishy.

They only serve Texas wines; should have had either a cocktail or beer.

I used to like I Trulli and was coming there on regular basis, but this time it was completely different,I ordered their tasting meny and it was so good.I am definitely  coming back

The food and wine were truly outstanding. I am so glad I don't live upstairs.

100% of food was great. Do not valet your car with them use one of the other stands around run by another company.

server was slow, but great food, great view! We will return again and tell our friends!The Theatre Special was a great value!

on a beautiful night the patio is fabulous. the food was average but ambiance was wonderful.

Not too loud. Food was great, and not too noisy to enjoy it.

most accomodating.

Food is good. Although the service is a little slow. Live music is good.
I'll come back.

will eat there again

Food was fair-to-good.

a very enjoyable dining experience; would recommend to anyone, though the atmosphere was a bit odd.
It was the perfect temp inside. I didn't want to get out of there so i

absolutely loved it good food good people, but slow service.

the steak I had was the best ever! so flavorful and prepared exactly as requested

Good service--didn't feel like I was being rushed out the door.

 My only complaint was the music. It was too loud, and not

food was good

great foo. Charming service, if a bit spacey. Nice room.

extensive lunch menu

we will be going their again

fabulous food (gnocchi is a must have!), but bad atmosphere and very reasonable prices for food and wine! i've already made another reservation to return next month!
Even though it is located in a strip mall, once inside the diner forgets that. The surroundings are elegant but casual, the service impeccable!

I had wanted to eat here for a long time, and I had big expectations. They were all met. The only downside was the noise. Corey (I hope I spell your name correctly) was fabulous. It was a great evening. Thank you!
Enjoyed on Valentine's Day. food was smaller than expected but great, and hostess and waitress was very nice.
Great outdoor patio. Service was wonderful. Made a reservation and waited only 5 minutes to be seated. Food was average, nothing special.
Excellent service, had to wait a little too long for the check

The view is just stunning. The food is always good. I wish they would have had their special dinner menu for $16.95 because that is the best deal in town. But it is still very pleasant, albeit very loud.
Everything was fine as normal. Atmosphere could be better. Will return and introduce to more people.

Home style and southern inspired food with a twist. Probably not worth the price ($22-30 for entrees, total bill with starters, wine and desert can easily run $50 per person before tax and tip). The noise level was perfect to hold a conversation however. Would recommend based on that.
Food was quite good, good variety, but eggplant parm needs to be added to the menu. The restaurant looks pretty though.
Great food, pleasant atmosphere, awesome service. Love, love, love it except for the loud noise level.
Very pleasant surroundings.
Perfectly good NY experience. Nice food and acceptable service.
Fantastic food. "Right" portioned. Possibly slightly overpriced for the portions, but still a very nice experience. Worth the visit though.

Thank you - we enjoyed the evening. As noted above, service was excellent, as was food. Noise level made it
difficult to converse, but still enjoyed it due to the comfortable chairs and the view.
Overall, it was very good. May try next time with another dessert.
Awful front desk girl...what a sour puss!  Amazing food!   Great pizza and garlic rolls!
Even though the gnochis were dry and stale, it had a great atmosphere and very reasonable prices for food and wine! i've already made another reservation to return next month!
good food with very good service by waiter. sarcastic remark by materdie while leaving. atmosphere was pleasant and fun.
Excellent choices for Sunday brunch. Staff was not friendly or polite.
Enjoyed the relaxing evening on Valentine's Day. Ambience was nice, food was smaller than expected but great, and hostess and waitress was very nice.
The food was outstanding, but the service was a bit slow! I love the large selection of choices on the menu, and the chairs are comfortable.
While not inexpensive, considering the view, level of service and food quality, I always feel I got my money's worth and more at Top of the Hub.
This is really a tourist attraction, more than a restaurant but still not to crowded or noisy. The view is obviously why you would go, not the food. Service was great, drinks too.
Well presented tasty food - attentive service. We saw all age groups. Although we didn't have the "small portion" menu it appears many others did. We liked the pre-fix options as well.
seafood with imaginative pairings.
LOVE Otto!! Everyone could not say enough about how delicious the food and wine was and the great atmosphere!
Food...outstanding! Portions...outstanding! Service...needs attention!!!!!

Have been here several times and the food is always great!!!! I have not had a large party in their private rooms but I would surly choose L'Andana to host a party. My one complaint is the decor -- very tacky, and disappointing for what's supposed to be a fine dining restaurant. Otherwise, great find that is not in the city.
We requested out door dining and they were very accomodating.
Far priced and under rated. Would recommend.
The restaurant seems to have had a change recently in its chef as evidenced by comparing previous pasta dishes. Still a good place for lunch or early dinner. I wish they would update the decor though
well priced for what you get. hamburger buns were fresh and kids burgers were large.
Unlike other neighborhood restaurants, it is a lot quieter and better for conversations.
I love Sens. I often go there. I love the food and wonderful atmosphere.  Can't stand how noisy it gets though.
We enjoyed the food very much and the service was very good. Overall was just kind of an ordinary experience but not disappointing. The live band was nice.
Sunday night - quiet as expected. Service was good as well.
The view is just stunning. The food is always good. I wish they would have had their special dinner menu for $16.95 because that is the best deal in town. But it is still very pleasant.
Great dining tucked in a neighborhood/industrial area. Food was outstanding but service was quite slow.
Our experience was outstanding. The service was overbearing
My boyfriend and I loved the modern ambiance and the impeccable service, but it was a bit too loud. We had an amazing table, even though we only reserved the table one week before we went.
My dining experience was one of the best. The food and service was outstanding. Everyone was very friendly just could have turned down the volume of the music a little.
outstanding seafood - one of my favorite restaurants despite the annoying decorations.
The food was great.
Seems to have gone uphill since our last visit. The tiramasu was still outstanding as was the rest of the food but  favorite antipasto platter was no longer available. Too bad !
Always enjoy going to Eddie Merlot's for the service. . If not so pricey, would go more often.
on a beautiful night the patio is fabulous. the food was average but service and were wonderful.
always dependable in service and food, not phenomenal but always good and fun, bread couldn't be better, same with the wine list, and prices are reasonable.............................

Small bistro, tight between the table. Try the Trio of Homemade Pate. This place is a great find in Kenmore Square!
The service was at the level that I was expecting for a restaurant that is owned by a renowned chef.
Satisfying. The use just the right amount of salt to season the food.
Excellent everything, but what a boring garden setting.
Great food and service...drinks were a little light on quantity..
Wait Staff was great. Very responsive to question regarding the menu choices. Very attentive to their guest. Food was a bit too salty though.
Food truly exceptional. Service a little to casual (just matter of fact), but still good.
Food was awesome, great list of beer and wine, great dinning experience except for the slow service.
The food, wine and service were truly outstanding. I am so glad I don't live upstairs, it is so loud and cluttered
Very exciting and they were stocked with many items
The food is always fresh and very good. The only thing I really don't like is to be forced to tip with the 20% that is included in the check!I prefer to put it by myself

we order tuna tha was on a special menu and they came back that they did not have anymore ... quiet and relaxing music
Service was good, we got seated right away, but the ambiance was not great. We order drinks and appetizers and a pizza, all were good!
Outstanding restaurant....food, service....ambiance..........would be best in Boston...except for the noise!
We have been here many times. The source is always very good.
lots of natural light which is a good thing.
We were seated downstairs, which loses some of ambiance and character and feeling that is upstairs. We all enjoyed the food.
Tables fairly close together, mushroom appetiser very good, pork entree fair, chicken good.
Great food, mediocre ambiance, as always. We will return often.
A wonderful find in Cambridge. Food was enjoyed by all. Wine selection varied and interesting. Enjoyed the Restaurant Week dinner menu. Small, too tight and has an outdated feel.
good location near the theater district
Service is OK. Food quality is so good and worth the money.
A very nice departure from the usual offerings found in the Reston/Herndon area. The wine list is very nice and the ambience is top notch.The staff reasonably knowledgeable although slightly rude.
From the fab reviews in Chicago papers, we were expecting an exceptinal meal. The beet salad was good, both of our pastas were extremely excellent.
Fantastic salads, mains and cocktails. Dessert was good but not extraordinary. There was a nice live band that played soothing music that was perfect pairing with our food.
just excellent food all of the time. Great staff that is knowledgeable, but sad to say the service was slow.

They have improved service and tightened up the ship here. They also got rid of the load music which was nice. Food is always good across the menu. Time to expand wine offerings by the glass and to add a seasonal short menu.
Terrific food and atmosphere. Perfect before or after museum visit. Valet parking (expensive) but worth it on a raindy day.
always dependable in service, not phenomenal but always good and fun, and prices are reasonable.............................
A good, solid all-around fish house. The kids menu is quite complete.
Great ambiance, food was available, will definitely be back.

It was the perfect place and spot on the patio for my Francophile husband's birthday. The escargots and the moules were delicious; only wish we had had room for dessert! Only complain is the noisy atmosphere. Will go again soon though!

Everyone was very attentIve and the food was good but on the sweet side for my taste. We ate the 12 course meal, which took too long. I think we were all ready to leave by the 8th or 9th course, but the ambiance was great.

The food and service was very good, My wife and I enjoyed a very nice dinner she had the Ahi Tuna and truly enjoyed it, and my dish was very good also, but I will try something different next time. The noise was very quiet and the music was soft in the background.

the gluten free menu is what brings me here...a nice neighborhood Italian restaurant with pleasant service. Only negative is the lighting is very dull and gloomy.

The staff were great, only negeative was the noise, it was hard to have a conversation,
The staff were great, the food was excellent but a bit noisy as it was hard to have a conversation . 
And yes we will return.
Great brunch menu, would have expected a bit more special planning for Easter sunday and it seemed like they were very short staffed, but the food was excellent. Gravitas is always a great choice!
consistently great cocktails. the ONLY downside is that the wine list is a little pricey and they won't let you BYOB. otherwise an outstanding place that never lets me down.

Great food and a great time! Wish our table had been larger, but the place is successful and busy!

Love this Restaurant and glad they changed the menu, it was needed.

Consistently great food & service at reasonable prices--Monday & Tuesday wine special-$10 per bottle is a favorite--Our family wished there was some updated paint and pictures though. It created a not so pleasant place to look around while enjoying a rather good meal.
Great service and food as usual, but the place is too noisy.
Server attentively brought the food to us on Valentine's day. We didn't feel rushed. A good experience and the food was tasty.
Our first time at Frankie's and we were all pleased. We will definitely go again.

The wait for the food was short and the server was great.
it was very good and the waiter Mo was fantastic..... The noise level was good to be in a restaurant that size.

I was very satisfied with the food and atmosphere but particularly pleased with the service delivered by our waiter Ramsey (sp?). He was very attentive and accommodating and really made our dining experience.
great atmosphere, food was delicious. The service was very slow.
You menu is an adventure and the server was charming although i could not hear him. We will be back again and again.
I like Paul, he's loud, but a great bartender.
Food was good
Lovely restaurant, good service.

We walked and stood there 5 minutes looking at the seater giving instructions to staff and then we got seated at the perfect table.. Not a waste of time and money. Great somalier(that what he sounded like)

This is our second time there--Excellent! Great food, but poor service and very reasonable prices for the quality.
excellent food and setting but waiters on the slower side- a great find!
My dinning experience was great. Pleasant atmosphere but was very loud..
Excellent food!!! Server just was very slow in getting us refills, bringing the check, etc.
The food, wine and service were truly outstanding. I am so glad I don't live upstairs.

Love the food, the service, but find the tables too close together.

The experience was excellant other than the noise level, would very much go again.

Very good for pre-theater lunch. Service was very good with great lighting

The food and service was very good, the poor ambiance was my only complaint. My wife and I enjoyed a very nice dinner she had the Ahi Tuna and truelly enjoyed it, and my dish was very good also, but I will try something different next time.
our 4th time to the restaurant - a must visit for us when we're in NY, but the service could be better.

It is far from quality i found in Benoit/Paris as far as service but the food was very good.

Food was good.
Great for midweek specials--with .

Great Experience.
Food was wonderful and thus, not over priced for what you get!
Some of the best service in the Twin Cities. This small Bistro has a wonderful winelist, and great entrees. However, it was hard to hear my partner while eating.
I enjoy the food. I always enjoy the waiters. Noise levels are great!
new so they are still working out service issues. Worth going back!
Great atmosphere and wonderful menu!! Lots of fun for a group of friends or a romantic dinner, but the service could have been better
Terrific service make it worthwhile.
The service was good. Very pleasant and attentive waiters. The atmosphere( in the back dining room) was very average.
Good place, solid as always. I am a return customer (I live a few blocks away). It was very good again. However, the specials were over-priced.
The food was amazing! I loved being able to walk around the house and explore, but it was pretty noisy! I would definitely recommend for anyone looking for a great, classy romantic evening!
phenomenal!! I would go again....and again...and again...but please lower the music volume!
excellent food, excellent servicc .The crab cake are exellent definely don't miss eating them! Just wish the ambiance had been a bit better though.
Fantastic! MIchael Chiarello was there too, stopping by each table to say hello.  But, ambiance was a little outdated.
Our watiress was great. I'm just sorry I forgot her name, but we did tip her well. The noise was perfect!

Reserved because of the $9.95 two-course lunch special. It was delicious and especially liked the  "lunch portion" size. Not too much heavy food for a lunch. Just right. I just wish the ambiance was a bit more welcoming.

excellent food, service, and setting- a great find!

Outstanding dining experience. Can't wait til I'm in town again, will definitely go have dinner again at this place. The Lamb Shank was the best I've ever eaten. The dining room could be quieter though.

Food: Pasta perfectly cooked, tomato sauce fresh, able to taste spices.

Service: Waiter admitted he was just beginning to cook.
Overall: Enjoyed dinner.
Love the service, but find the tables too close together and a little noisy.

Everything was fine as normal. Will return and introduce to more people.

great beer selection, french fries.

Server was a delight. Food, well...MMMMMMMMmmmmmmmm.

Mostly pretty good. Service was very good.

Excellent oysters on the half shell, crabcakes one of the best around.

Thanks!

always enjoy this spot. Best pizza in Atlanta! The ambiance was not that good

as good as we'd expected....many choices for vegetarians....our service was good

Service great and was a great place.
One of the better Theater District Choices. Nice space with good fod. walking distance to most theaters.

wine list is great; pasta was very good. overall food was a pleasant surprise

the server and Chef were very nice about menu special requests.

great beer selection

Excellent choices for Sunday brunch.

we appreciated, worked with our tight schedule to make it to the symphony on time.

The people were nice-and the food was good.
Great atmosphere.

Excellent seafood choices and marvelous creme brulee. Very attentive and accomodating service staff. The music a bit too loud though.

The food was very good.

the restaurant was populated and good volume level when we dined there the other evening.
This was a pleasant surprise for us. The vibe inside was very positive. There were 3 in our party, there were many choices of foods of interest for us, in fact it was hard to choose. We will return.
A wonderful find in Cambridge. Food was enjoyed by all. Wine selection varied and interesting. Enjoyed the Restaurant Week dinner menu.

The experience was excellant, would very much go again.
The food would keep me coming back to this wonderful location, my salad was nothing but excellent.
The food and attention to detail were excellent. This is a wonderful restaurant with a beautiful view.
One of the best, including restaurants in Italy. I have family in Rome so I visit Italy almost every year.
This is our 2nd time and the restaurant, food, service, and atmosphere was excellent. Looking forward to going there again when I am in New Haven, CT.

A lively, fun place, with reasonably priced food!

Always lovely...fabulous food. How can you go wrong?
Would definitely return, as this was our first visit.
Excellent for pre-opera. Service very good.
Wonderful service and food. The waitstaff goes out of their way to make our dining experience delightful. And I love the special offers!

service fantastic, not my first time at this restaurant, won't be the last
